text: A TAXI pulls over to a curb where an ELDERLY MAN waits wi his MIDDLE-AGED SON in THE RAIN.
(as they climb in) 23rd and Lex. The CABBIE grunts a reply.
How ya doin', Papa, you doin' alright?
Fine, fine...

This is just a check-up, okay? Doctor Katz says you'll outlive us all. (looks out the window) Traffic isn't bad. We should be back in time to watch the Mets. He notices his father is STARING, wide-eyed, at the cabby HACK LICENSE. We glimpse only the last name..."Bielski."
Papa? .Papa, what is it? IN THE REAR VIEW MIRROR, the old man catches the furtive eyes of the cabby.
...You. Can it be? The eyes in the mirror look away. And then back.
Bielski. Can it possibly be? As we PUSH IN on the eyes in the mirror, we HEAR THE DESPERATE RASPING SOUND OF PANTING.

head_text.subj: A MAN RUNNING FOR HIS LIFE THROUGH THE WOODS. 2

text: Bombs EXPLODE all around as he passes dead bodies and BUR OUT VEHICLES. Without slowing he discards a WW II Red Arm helmet, a field jacket, a heavy pack, anything that might impede his flight. He glances back up over his shoulder. The sky is filled with BOMBERS. He runs on. SALMON Revision - 8-18-07 2.

A typical Eastern European shtetl. LOCAL POLICE help Germ Einsatzgruppen, mobile killing squads, round up Jews. PEASANTS beat them with sticks as they are herded into li One man tries to run and is beaten. Others look on, or look away with indifference as they ar loaded onto waiting trucks.

head_text.subj: TWO MEN HIDE IN THE NEARBY WOODS

text: We study their faces: a turbulent portrait of impotent ra terrible fear, overwhelming grief, and secret relief.
Where are they taking them?
--Shveig! Shveig!
Just shut up! Please...
The man we last saw in flight (TUVIA BIELSKI) wearing the remnants of his uniform, slips down a cobble-stoned stree He ducks into a doorway as A PATROL passes by.
Zus and Asael move warily through a barnyard. A tethered dog BARKS furiously. A farmer challenges them.
(in Russian; subtitles)
Walencki brandishes a pitchfork.
(in Russian; subtitles) Some food...?
They are looking for you people. The two brothers glance nervously around.
Get away from here! GO! ZUS, the older of the two brothers, takes a menacing step toward the farmer but his younger brother holds him back. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 3.
Zus. Let's go. As they retreat toward the woods, Zus warns the farmer.
We'll be back.
Tuvia is getting dressed as AN ATTRACTIVE WOMAN -- his wi RIFKA -- stands by the window, smoking a cigarette.
And no news of my brothers?
They are used to trouble, they'll be all right.
If you stay, you'll have to go to the ghetto.
I can get false papers and pass as a gentile. So can you. Tuvia shakes his head, no. He finishes dressing. Theirs is a relationship long past passion.
Will you at least stay tonight?
I need to see to my family. Will you come?
To the country? No.
A PAIR OF LEGS lie motionless behind a trough. Beyond, A MAN'S TORSO. Zus and Asael stare in mute horror.
Papa-- Gottenyu... Flies buzz about dead LIVESTOCK. A WOMAN'S BODY lies near
A still portrait of a life interrupted. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 4.

A table set for dinner. Candles lit. An open book. A NOISE from a cupboard. Zus grabs a hatchet. From the root cellar, a YOUNG BOY, 14, appears. His face is dirty and tear-streaked. They go to embrace him.
Aron. The boy (ARON) recoils. He is disoriented and WILL NOT SPEAK.
Loaded down with possessions, Asael hurries back to the woods. Zus pauses long enough to pry the mezuzah from the door.
Aron stares mutely straight ahead. Asael is shaking uncontrollably and crying. Zus is at a loss what to do.
Stop it... But Asael is lost in a confusion of grief and panic.
Stop it. STOP IT! Finally Zus grabs him in a gesture halfway between violen and comfort...and holds him as Asael rocks back and forth
A million acres of dense, impenetrable woods and swamps.

head_text.subj: ASAEL AND ARON SLEEP HUDDLED ON THE GROUND 12

text: The sound of a FOOTSTEP. They sit up in terror.
If I was a German you are dead.
Tuvia! Asael leaps up to embrace him as if he were salvation its
Papa and Mama. They killed them. (CONTINUED)
TAN Revision - 9-10-07 5.
Asael clings to him. Even Aron allows himself to be held. Tuvia hold them silently. Zus appears, hatchet in hand.
Big brother returns. Tuvia and Zus look at each other warily.
You saw them? Yes. Tuvia saw them. Zus takes the mezuzah from his pocke tosses it to Tuvia.
Welcome home.
is torn apart by filthy hands as they move through the tr
Are you going back to the army?
There is no more army. Asael worships his big brother.
Hope at least you killed a few. Tuvia just stares at him.
What is it like? To be in a war?
It wasn't war. It was something else. Zus eyes him carefully.
Where is Sonia and the baby?
Horodysze. Hiding in a cellar. I'll bring her when it is safe. Where is Rifka?
In Novgrudok. She wouldn't leave.
You are still separated?
She is still my wife. (CONTINUED)
YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 6.
Your rich wife. Zus chews with the open-mouthed relish of a peasant.
So why exactly have you come back? Tuvia just stares at him. The reason is obvious as he hol his younger brothers.
You have a plan?
No. Do you?
Shivering and miserable, they are trying to start a fire. Asael's few remaining matches are sodden.
Is there anything left to eat? Only a few potatoes in Asael's bag. WORMS writhe among them.
Zus finished the last of the sausage. Tuvia glares at Zus, who glares back. Sibling rivals.
Stankowicz' farm is closest.
He has dogs.
Fuck the dogs. Wilencki then.
You think Wilencki is going to give us food?
No. We take it.
How?
We...Take...It. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-18-07 7.
And he tells the police.
I have run from the police my whole life. Do you really think it's a good time to stop? A moment of decision. Who holds the balance of power?
We know these woods. They'll never find us in here. Tuvia looks at his brothers. He has been outvoted.
where Zus and Asael first tried to get food. Asael waits outside, anxiously on guard.
The farmer (WALENCKI) who threatened them with the pitchf sits eating a simple dinner. Zus and Tuvia burst in. Zus brandishes a hoe.
(in Russian; subtitles) We want food. Be quick about it!
(in Russian; subtitles) You again!
Sure, sure. Take what you want... Tuvia begins to stuff provisions into a sack.
Where is your gun, farmer?
I have no gun. Zus grabs a dinner plate and SMASHES IT IN THE FARMER'S FACE.
Holding his bloody face, the farmer cowers in fear. (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 8.
Please... Zus kicks him.
I beg you...
He's lying. He kicks him again. The farmer begins to weep.
You're lying! Zus dumps the remains of the farmer's dinner onto him.
If I hit you once more, you will shit your pants. Twice and you will never shit again. The farmer knows Zus won't hesitate.
Up there... Zus kicks the man aside. Above the stove is an old rifle. Zus grabs it, points it at the farmer.
We were never here.
running through the woods. Zus raises the rifle in triump
He was willing to help us.
He's lucky I didn't crush his head. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
TAN Revision - 9-10-07 9.
Fucking Polack. I've eaten shit from these people long enough!
This is your plan? To terrorize every anti-Semite in Belorussia?
No. Some I will kill.

Aron has been left alone. He holds a STICK which he "shoo like a gun -- kachew -- as he creeps from tree to tree. Aron freezes. SOMETHING is moving in the trees. He crouches. A dark blur. An animal? It moves off. He follow The shape appears again. It's a SMALL GIRL, roughly Aron' age. Aron waves at her. The girl stares, then runs off. Aron hurries after her into a wooded grove, then stops sh A PILE OF NAKED CORPSES. Overflows a newly-dug trench. The small girl runs to A MIDDLE-AGED MAN with a crude Star-of-David sewn to his tattered coat. He holds an OLDER GIRL, 14, in his arms. Nearby, three or four OTHERS emerge from hiding. Starved, in tatters, the living waiting to die.
where the three brothers gorge themselves on stolen food. Someone FARTS loudly.
Ah...
You know what Papa would do when you did that at table... Tuvia smacks Zus on the head, taking on a gruff voice.
Peasant. (CONTINUED)
TAN Revision - 9-10-07 10.
Tuvia imitates his father's criticism of Zus. Asael laugh Zus can't help but laugh as well. Even in grief there is laughter. A glimpse of ties that bind them.
I can't believe Papa's dead.
Bernicki.
The police captain?
We don't know he did it.
He always had it in for Papa.
We don't know he did it.
So we will go and ask him if he did.
Koscik has a pistol. He showed it to me once.
One pistol isn't enough. We need rifles. Machine guns.
Machine guns? You're going to take on the whole German army?

Just because you didn't... The SOUND of footsteps. Zus jumps up cocking the rifle. ARON emerges from the trees. And then, behind him, THE SURVIVORS he discovered among the corpses. THE MIDDLE-AGED MAN holds a teenage GIRL by one hand and carries his younger daughter.
The child is hurt. The brothers stare at him. Wary and unwelcoming.
Set her down. The man lowers the child to the ground. She isn't moving.
I am Avram Rubinski. This is my daughter. She-- The Germans-- (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 11.

He cannot bring himself to say the words. OTHERS shuffle forward, still in shock, barely able to speak their grati as Tuvia offers chunks of bread and cheese. The man tries to feed his daughter. She is barely alive. Asael turns to Aron. Gently.
Where did you find them? Aron still won't speak. Asael addresses the other girl.
Your sister is sick?
They kept her for a week. We fill in the rest.
Zus has moved out of earshot. Tuvia joins him.
We cannot feed them.
I'll go ask Koscik for food.
And the pistol.
And the pistol. Without another word, he starts off.
Remember to say please.
Koscik, a rotund, florid-faced Pole, hands it to Tuvia.
I have only four bullets. (CONTINUED)
BLUE Revision - 6-26-07 12.
I cannot thank you enough. They sit in Koscik's warmly-lit kitchen. Koscik's WIFE stands silently by the stove, glaring at Tuvia.
Your father was a good man.
He said the same of you. Tuvia can't help but notice Koscik's wife giving him the evil eye. Koscik produces a bottle of vodka.
Ignore the bitch. (raising the bottle) To the dead. God rest their souls. (in Russian; subtitles) Bitch-- Do you want vodka? His wife just glares at him.
I live with this, can you imagine? HEADLIGHTS sweep over the window. A CAR is fast approachi
Hide yourself. ...The barn. 21 TUVIA HURRIES ACROSS THE COURTYARD AND INTO THE BARN.
He climbs a ladder and is startled to find FIVE MORE MEN AND WOMEN in hiding. They stare in mute terror.
Koscik greets A BELARUSSIAN POLICE CAPTAIN and his SONS a they exit the car. They speak in Russian, with subtitles:
Working late, boys.
Hunting Jews. Our new bosses are very organized. Koscik offers the bottle.
Hunting can work up a thirst. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 13.
Fifteen in one day. The council is offering a year's free tax for every one you turn in. -
A Jew is worth that much? Do you pay more for a fat one? They laugh appreciatively.
A man COUGHS then shrugs an apology. Tuvia glares at him.
Caught five of them hiding in a ditch. Smelled so bad I was afraid the Germans wouldn't want them.
Maybe for a reduced price. More laughter. More vodka.
You know the Bielski's?
Sure.
We missed two when we visited the parents.
Tuvia listens to this casual talk of his parent's death.
Anybody caught helping them is in for it. You know this, Koscik?
Do I look like an idiot? Don't answer so quickly... More laughter. The Police Captain looks at his watch. Yawns. (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 14.
Been at it since dawn. The wife doesn't like these long nights. He tries to hand back the bottle to Koscik.
Keep it.
Bribing an officer of the law? Maybe you have more of this black market vodka hidden in the barn?
Take a look. And clean out the cow shit while you're back there. The policeman laughs and climbs back into the car.
You'll keep your eyes open, yes?
Good hunting.
Koscik and Tuvia speak in harsh whispers.
--If the laborers find them tomorrow, I will be denounced--
What am I supposed to do with--
Take them into the forest--
--And feed them how? I can't care for my own family. Behind them, several of the REFUGEES have emerged from th hiding place. They stare at Tuvia balefully.
The refugees are loaded with provisions. A young man, PIN ZUCKERMAN, has a tethered GOAT. Another man carries a vio case. Koscik hands Tuvia another bottle of vodka.
Those men? They were the ones who killed my parents? (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 15.
Koscik doesn't want to tell him. Finally he nods, yes.
You people. Why is it so fucking hard to be friends with a Jew? They embrace.
Imagine being one. Tuvia leads his motley band toward the woods.
Tuvia leads them. He notices an OLD MAN staring at him.
You sat in back. Tuvia just looks at him.
In school. I am Shimon H'aretz.
I thought you were dead.
I am at least half-dead. (after a moment) I heard them speaking of your parents. I am very sorry. Tuvia shakes his head.
And the other brothers? What was his name, the wild one?
Zus. He's with the other two.
You are hiding here? In the forest? Tuvia nods.
There has been trouble before maybe? With the police? Tuvia doesn't answer. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 16.
So now you go to the forest. A wise choice.
For a dumb schoolboy, you mean.
My whole life I presumed to teach others the right way to live. I had no doubt: this is God's way, this isn't. You'll forgive me if recent events have somewhat shaken my resolve.
It is just like school, I don't know what you're talking about. (touching him) Teacher...Come... Come. (gesturing to the
Please.
The new arrivals squat by a fire where potatoes are cooki in the ashes. Everyone shares from the soup pot. There aren't enough spoons to go around. Shimon offers Aron something to eat.
Here... You're not hungry? Aron doesn't respond.
The little one does not talk?
He saw. Things.
stares fixedly as Avram digs his daughter's grave. The gu is still in his belt. Zus is constructing a shelter.
I send you for food and you bring more mouths to feed.
You send me?
Did you at least get the gun? (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 16A.
Tuvia shows him.
Only four bullets.
Then we'll have to make them count. Zus heads for the food. Asael is trying to start a fire but the kindling is wet.
Here... Shimon takes a book from his coat, rips out pages covered in Hebrew and crumples them into the fire. They burst int flame.
The Psalms have many uses.

watching as they eat hungrily. Tuvia stops near Avram DIGGING a grave before heading out of the camp. We realize Avram's daughter has died while Tuvia was away. THE SOUND OF DISTANT THUNDER. DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 17.
Tuvia stands in the driving rain, shaking. He stares at t lit windows.
The POLICE CAPTAIN we saw earlier eats dinner with his WI and TWO SONS. They speak in Russian.
You worked late. The man nods, his mouth full of food.
Tomorrow is Sunday. You have a day off, yes?
(still chewing; nods) ...Fucking SS never sleeps... The door OPENS slowly. They all look up. (CONTINUED)
YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 18.
Tuvia stands on the threshold, dripping wet, a spectral figure. He holds the pistol at his side.
You know who I am? The policeman says nothing. His wife is instantly terrifi One of the SONS stands. Tuvia turns the gun on him.
Sit. The son obeys. The SOUND of the rain on the tin roof is deafening. Tuvia turns back to the Police Captain.
And you know why I am here.
...what are you talking about?
You have no idea what I'm talking about...
If they say find someone, I find him. It's my job.
To find Jews.
Or lose my job.
And it's a good job, isn't it? You like your job.
I was always fair with your family. ...Everyone knew you were smuggling this and that. But I looked the other way. (in desperation) ...Ask your father.
My father? You don't talk about my father... Tuvia places the pistol against the man's forehead.
Down on your knees. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 19.
(BELLOWING)
The policeman begins to weep.
For my parents, David and Beila Bielski... for my brothers and all the others--

Please.... I beg you... One of the man's SONS makes a move toward Tuvia. Tuvia SHOOTS him in the chest. His mother SCREAMS. The Policema suddenly starts to stand. Tuvia backs away, shoots him. And then the other son. It is all over in seconds.
The police captain's wife is prostrate and KEENING over h dead family in Russian.
Kill me, too! Tuvia should indeed kill her, too. To avoid being identified.
Tell them who did this.
The rain still pours down on the house as Tuvia runs away
Tuvia pushes through dense forest. Branches rake his face Finally he leans against a tree. We move CLOSE on his fac

Riboynoy shel oylam, riboynoy shel oylam... (closes his eyes) Lord of the universe, forgive me, I have murdered -- but they were monsters and did not deserve to live. DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 20.

Zus awakens, sodden and stiff. He looks at the group, now numbering fourteen. People sleep huddled together: Asael holds Aron; Avram keeps his surviving daughter close. And there is Tuvia -- sitting by the fire. Zus takes the pistol from Tuvia's belt. Checks the cylinder.
Only one bullet left.
His sons. Zus nods his approval.
How was it?
What?
To kill them. It was good, no?
Shut up. Tuvia stares into the fire. He is dirty and tired. Zus looks around.
What are we going to do with these others?
I don't know--
The women will slow us down. And your old teacher--
You're afraid he's going to beat you for forgetting your homework.
We have to be able to keep moving, and quickly.
I agree. But they're here. They consider their predicament. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 21.
We'll sleep farther up the trail. If anyone comes, they'll find them first. The gunshots will give us time to escape.
Alright. But no more.
No more.
stumbling into camp behind Tuvia, who carries a heavy sac of provisions. Zus gives Tuvia a look.
I know. I know... Tamara, you remember Cousin Zus. Please, go sit down by the fire. And this is Lazar -- Isabel's youngest... Tamara is pleasant-looking but emotionally wounded.
This is Isaac Malbin. From Minsk. Malbin is sweet-faced with little round Trotsky glasses.
Asael, find them something to eat.
Zus takes Tuvia aside.
Tuvia, I have pity for them all,
They are family.
And how will we feed this family?
We'll water the soup. One of the new arrivals is a DARK-HAIRED BEAUTY. Tuvia an Zus watch her pass. Zus is particularly interested.
And this one, is she family?
No. By the fire, the veterans pepper the newcomers with (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 A21.
questions. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 21A.
You are from Lida! Is Isadore Korein alive?
There are so many in the ghetto, I don't know...
Does anyone have news from Vilna? DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 22.

Food, such as it is, is being handed out to SEVERAL NEW ARRIVALS. Asael brushes Aron's hair. Rachel sits beside her grieving father. She looks at Aron. He looks back. Nearby, Tuvia and Malbin are building a shelter. Malbin i hopelessly inept. A wall COLLAPSES.
Fuck me! Have you never used a hammer?
Uh. No.
What is it you do, then?
I suppose...you'd have to say...I was...am...an intellectual.
This is a job?
I published a small magazine... actually a journal...well, more like a pamphlet. Zus passes them, his arm around the dark-haired beauty.
Tuvia, this is Rona. Rona is my forest wife.
I see. Congratulations. Zus winks and walks past. Malbin and Tuvia watch them.
Interesting concept.
As long as his village wife stays in hiding.
Nice to know there are some things even Hitler can't destroy. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 23.
Suddenly the camp grows quiet. TWO YOUNG MEN who have emerged from the forest, their clo dirty and torn. One of them aims an army-issue rifle.
Hello, boys, what can we do for you?
Food. We want food. Everyone remains still. Zus eyes his own rifle nearby.
These little shits are holding us up. The Young Man motions his partner to take Zus's rifle.
You little shits have the balls to shoot me? In response, the young man CHAMBERS A ROUND.
This is all the food we have. You are welcome to share.
No. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 23A.
I want to see if this little shit will shoot me. You like shooting Jews, you little shit?
You are Jews? (CONTINUED)
GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 24.
No. We're the Gestapo, you little shit.
Come. Sit. Put down your guns.
Or perhaps you'd prefer I shove them up your ass.
Where are you from? The young man glares at Zus. Then, to Tuvia:
Horodyszcze. The name freezes Zus in his tracks. His wife is there.
We haven't eaten in two days. My name is Peretz, this is Jacov.
Two days ago there were three thousand Jews in Horodyszcze. Now there are fifty. Me and him, we hid in a wall.
You know a woman there, Sonia Bielski? The men look at one another.
We knew her. Zus can hardly bring himself to ask the next question.
...There was a child. Jacov shakes his head. Sorry. Zus leans his head against a tree. After a moment he begi to BEAT HIS HEAD against it until BLOOD pours down his fa

(to the newcomers) His family. Tuvia puts his arms around his brother. Zus's shoulders begin to heave. Soon his body convulses with deep wrackin sobs. He is absolutely unself-conscious in his grief. (CONTINUED)
GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 25.
So many dead.
I know.
Mama. Papa. Their heads are close together, their faces wet with tear
Why not us?
I don't know.
I thought they'd be safe. I should have been with them.
No.
I could have protected them. Tuvia just holds him. He, too, is crying quietly.
Better to be rabbits? Hunted? Hiding? No... Zus breaks free of Tuvia's embrace and walks away.
Jacov and Peretz are eating. Between ravenous bites--
We are looking for partisans.
What is the name of your otriad? Tuvia laughs ruefully.
What is an 'otriad?'
An armed brigade.
We heard the Russians are beginning to organize. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 26.
Here?
And also in the Lipicanska.
Then we are the Bielski Otriad. You want to join?
(looks around) The Russians are fighters.
--But you need a gun to join them. Without a gun you are nothing. They sabotage railroads and kill Germans.
We will kill all the Germans you can handle. Starting tonight. They stare up at him, his face a mask of blood and filth.
If you're not afraid to use that rifle.
Zus is loading Wilencki's gun.
--we must get what we need without killing. We can't make more enemies-- Zus concentrates on opening the breach.
--It won't bring your family back to life. Or Mama. Or Papa.
Blood for blood. You had your revenge. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 27.
And I can still see their faces.
'Vengeance is mine.' Who said that?
So this is God's work you're doing, Zussie?
No. Only YOU can play God. Save a few lives, take a few others...
We cannot become...like them.
If only... (a hard look) Are you coming with us or not?
Us?
Peretz and Jacov. (POINTEDLY)
Asael, too. Tuvia looks over at Asael, who looks away.
(to Zus) You are making the decisions now? A stand-off. Zus stares back at him. The struggle for command has grown more obvious.
We wait for dark.
Lights up the night sky. A MAN comes running out of a tavern, the same man who loaded Jews onto trucks in an earlier scene.
My truck! WHO DID THIS TO MY TRUCK? Tuvia, Zus and the others appear out the shadows.
We did. (CONTINUED)
GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 28.
The man stops short at the sight of their weapons.
Who are you? (REALIZING)
You don't understand. They made me give them my truck... Zus FIRES. Jacov and Peretz follow suit. The man goes down. They throw his DEAD BODY onto the burning truck.
Zus and Peretz are backing out of an open doorway, FIRING BACK INSIDE AS THEY GO. From within, the sound of SCREAMS

head_text.subj: THIS IS WHAT YOU GET WHEN YOU

text: FACES appear furtively at the windows of nearby houses. Zus addresses the little neighborhood, delirious with joy
Tuvia looks around warily. This is getting out of hand.
Tuvia and Asael lie in on one side of a road. Tuvia has looped ONE END OF THE WIRE around a post.

head_text.subj: IN THE DITCH ON THE OTHER SIDE 45

text: Zus, Peretz, and Jacov WRAP THE WIRE to a tree.
The lights of a MOTORCYCLE, a GERMAN COURIER.
Tuvia waits until the BIKE is almost upon them. Then he TIGHTENS the WIRE so it stretches INVISIBLY ACROSS THE RO GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 29.

by the wire. His bike goes sliding away as the Bielski's swarm him, KILLING HIM with the last bullet from the Mahkarov. ZUS rummages through the downed-bike's saddlebags. He fin a beautiful KNIFE and lifts it up triumphantly.
Look--! MORE HEADLIGHTS fast approaching.
Hide! Everyone! They all scramble back into the ditch, dragging the dead courier with them.
approaches. As its headlights pick up the downed motorcyc it slows and pulls off to the side --
Where Tuvia and Zus are concealed. From within the car, w hear VOICES SPEAKING GERMAN. A YOUNG PRIVATE gets out and walks up the road to investigate.
(in German; subtitled) It's one of ours, but no one is here. Maybe he was drunk? From the car, an SERGEANT yells a reply.

(in German; subtitled) Move it off the road before the convoy passes. I'll report the sonuvabitch. As the soldier drags the bike off the road, AN OFFICER st out of the car and lights a cigarette. He's followed by the Sergeant. He carries a Schmeisser SUBMACHINE GUN dangling from his shoulder.
can see the Sergeant's feet peeking out over the ditch.
Cascades onto him. He tries to inch his body away... (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 30.

catches the flicker of MOVEMENT below, SEES Zus lying in the ditch. Stunned, he tries to zip up his fly. It catche ZUS LEAPS UP brandishing the KNIFE. He's on the Sergeant before he can get the gun off his shoulder. Stabbing him through his greatcoat, the BLADE BREAKS OFF IN HIS HAND. MEANWHILE, THE LIEUTENANT drops his cigarette, reaching under his coat for a pistol. Tuvia TACKLES him. The GUN skids away. They roll around on the road, CLAWING, PUNCHI BITING. Tuvia SLAMS the man's head against the pavement.
The Private sees Asael and Peretz coming at him. Jacov follows with his rifle. The Private turns and runs down the road. They give chase.

Another OFFICER is in the back seat with A WOMAN. He reac for his gun, stands up in the seat and begins FIRING WILD at Tuvia. TUVIA ROLLS UNDER THE CAR, avoiding the burst. MEANWHILE, ZUS USES THE HANDLE OF THE KNIFE to BREAK the Sergeant's nose. He RIPS the SCHMEISSER away, firing poin blank into the man, whose greatcoat CATCHES FIRE.
The officer takes close aim at Tuvia, just as ZUS TURNS T MACHINE GUN on the car BLOWING OUT THE WINDOWS, killing t Officer and the woman -- and saving his brother's life.
Jacov fires at the Private, MISSES. The man keeps RUNNING Jacov fires again. MISSES AGAIN. FINALLY his THIRD SHOT hits him in the leg. The Private keeps running. Limping now.
I got him! Peretz and Asael can now catch up to the soldier.
We SEE them knock the Private to the ground, KICKING him until Jacov catches up to them and FIRES A FINAL SHOT. GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 31.
Tuvia stands, out of breath.
Stupid! The gunfire could be heard for miles.
He was pissing on my head. Zus is high from the killing, covered in the dead man's blood. He begins calling out orders.
Peretz, Jacov, check the car for guns... (to Tuvia) This one's yours. He presents him with the Schmeisser as if it were a troph Tuvia accepts it, checking the gun efficiently.
I'll check his pockets for more ammo.
Hurry--!
Peretz and Jacov emerge with two MACHINE-PISTOLS, several BOTTLES OF SCHNAPPS and a beautiful LEICA CAMERA.
They were on their way to a party! They toss one bottle to Zus and another to Tuvia.
Asael stands over the dead Private. He isn't much older than Aron.
ZUS rifles the pockets of the dead Sergeant for ammo. He finds cigarettes and the man's wallet. He opens it.
Welcome to Belarus, herr Henkel. A CHAMPAGNE CORK POPS as Peretz and Jacov toast their victory.
Now we are real Partisans... (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 32.
To the Bielski Otriad!
are rounding the bend. Troop trucks. The Staff Car was leading A CONVOY.
Into the fields! RUN! Tuvia pulls Peretz off the road, but Jacov reloads his ri and begins to FIRE at the approaching trucks.

Jacov, NO! THE TRUCKS STOP. Troops pour off and begin RETURNING FIRE Jacov is CUT DOWN by a MACHINE GUN. Peretz, Zus, and Tuvia race into the WHEAT FIELD. It's no clear if they can make it into the woods. A FLARE IGNITES OVERHEAD turning the wheat fields BRIGHT WHITE in flicker incandescence. Malbin is almost paralytic with fear. ASAEL doesn't know which way to run. He plunges into the WHEAT FIELD...but ON THE WRONG SIDE OF THE ROAD. ONE OF THE TRUCKS drives forward, CUTTING HIM OFF, using its SPOTLIGHT to reveal him. FIFTEEN SOLDIERS start after him.
We watch as they CONVERGE on him.
Have almost made it into the woods when PERETZ IS HIT. He falls. Tuvia and Zus pick him up and half-carry, half-dra him into the sanctuary of the forest.
Zus. His rifle. Zus races back to pick up Peretz's weapon.
has realized his mistake. He tries to circle back toward the woods but the SOLDIERS move to CUT HIM OFF. He is fas but not fast enough. We realize he isn't going to make it
Tuvia and Zus look at the scene with mounting horror. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 33.
Asael... He rips the rifle from Zus's hands. For a moment we think he's going to go back after him. Instead, he wedges the rifle into a tree-trunk and takes careful aim...

Plunging the field into darkness as the flare burns out. ASAEL seizes the moment and dives to his knees, disappear from view and CRAWLING NOW rather than expose himself. AN IRRIGATION DITCH is nearby. Frantically he DIGS into the soft mud on its banks. As he scrapes his hands raw, h can HEAR his pursuers drawing near, CALLING OUT to one another.

A somber mood. Tuvia watches someone scrape at the porrid congealed in an empty pot. OTHERS stare listlessly into space. ONE MAN chews on a piece of leather, ANOTHER sucks on an old chicken bone. Zus, meanwhile, is in the middle of a nasty drunk from th captured schnapps. Nearby, Aron shares his ration of brea with Rachel. Little enough, but a connection is made. Peretz lies nearby. Malbin is trying to comforts him. There is nothing that can help him. Malbin looks to Tuvia
They thought you were bringing food. Tuvia just stares at him.
Did the farmers stop you? Still no answer from Tuvia.
They had guns? Dogs?
No.
I don't understand. Tuvia says nothing. Nearby, a child cries in hunger.
The Talmud says if you save a life you must take responsibility for it. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 34-34A.
Again I have no idea what you are talking about. Around them, the beseeching eyes of so many hungry faces.
I think you do.
You are the Bielski's? A MAN stands in the clearing. BEN ZION GULKOWITZ is tall, well muscled, a rifle strapped over his shoulder.
How'd you get past the Lazar?
Who? Zus stands unsteadily, then lurches into the woods, leani on an occasional tree for support. He finds the erstwhile sentry --LAZAR -- ambling toward him.
You shit! You worthless shit! Zus punches him, knocking him the ground. In a sloppy, drunken frenzy, Zus SLAPS him again.
Enough!
He walked right by you! Someone could have been killed! Tuvia pulls Zus off him.
I said, enough! (to Lazar) Get up! Get up!
If we were real partisans he'd be shot.
He made a mistake! (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 35.
MISTAKE! We cannot make mistakes! As Zus goes for Lazar again, Tuvia roughly PULLS HIM OFF. Zus goes flying, tripping over, landing on his ass.
That's right, Zus. No mistakes. Like last night. (looks at him) First they will torture Asael...and then they will hang him. Tuvia walks away, leaving his brother on the ground.
Tuvia rejoins them. Ben Zion looks up at him.
You are Tuvia Bielski.
You know me?
I am Ben Zion Gulkowitz. Ben Zion is besieged by questions about friends and famil
Pardon me, you are from Vilna. My sister lives on Passaya Street.
The SD came without warning. Hundreds were taken. No one knows where. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 36.
THE WOMAN begins to cry.
My poor sister...dear God, no... Meanwhile, Peretz's MOANING ceases. A woman grumbles:
We'd be better off in the ghetto...
At least here we are safe.
There at least we had hope...
No. Here, we have hope. A FEW MORE join in, grumbling their dissatisfaction. Othe take the opposite position. These are Jews, after all, an arguing is a revered sport and a pastime. It escalates.
We are hungry! This is a defining moment for Tuvia. When at first he speaks, it is awkward, ineffectual amid the growing tumul
I know we have no food. But tomorrow... tomorrow will be another mission.
Look what happened the last time.
That was a mistake! But the mistakes we made will not be made again! More objections. Tuvia must raise his voice to be heard.
We could be here a long time. And we have to prepare.
How?
Better security. Better at getting food and information-- (talking over their
--at making shelters. Whatever is needed. We all participate. We don't work against each other. At this he looks directly at Zus. Daring him to object. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 36A.
I want to kill Nazis, too, but we...just...cannot afford revenge. Not right now. We cannot afford to lose friends like Jacov and Peretz. A small voice speaks up.
Or Asael. Everyone stares. It is the first time Aron has spoken. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 37.
Or Asael. We... We-- (trying to hold it

--cannot lose anyone. He looks from face to face. Filthy, ravaged, many of them with tears in their eyes. This is what they need -- leadership, faith, something to believe in. And gradually, his tentativeness and awkwardness is repla by something else. A new voice. From deep inside.
...We will map out where we've been so as to not visit the same farms too often. And we take only from those who can afford to give, and leave those who can't alone.
The poorest farmer has more than us.

True. But what I am saying is... what I mean is... We are not thieves. (his resolve growing with every word) Or murderers. We may be hunted like animals but we will not become animals. (looks at them all) We have all chosen this -- to live free, like human beings, for as long as we can. Each day of freedom is an act of faith. And if we die trying to live, at least we die like human beings. His mission statement. A vision of their future. Everyone nods in mute acknowledgement. Zus lowers his hea The shift in power between them has occurred. Tuvia has emerged as the undisputed leader.
The trees take on color as if in celebration of their com together.
All is quiet as Tuvia, Zus and Ben Zion watch from the wo (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 38.
Now. They leave their cover and approach warily, guns at the ready.
Koscik's wife looks up from her garden and glares at them
Hello. She refuses to be flattered. In Russian:
In the barn.
Zus calls out.
Koscik, put your pants back on and leave those sheep alone. He steps into the shadows to find:

head_text.subj: KOSCIK HANGING FROM A THRESHING HOOK

text: that has been driven through his chest. A sign attached t the hook reads (in Polish) "JEW LOVER."
is just beyond the barn. Tuvia finishes piling on the las shovelful of earth. Koscik's wife stares straight ahead.
I'm sorry.
(a monotone) Come.
dug into a hillside. Overgrown with tall grass it is undetectable. Koscik's wife opens the heavy door, reveali ASAEL, who emerges blinking into the bright light.
Thank God. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 39.
Zus pulls his lost brother into a mighty embrace.
Zus.... ZUSSIE... I can't breathe. Zus lets him go and Asael reaches back into the root cell
Look. Two LOVELY YOUNG WOMEN -- BELLA and CHAYA -- emerge, tentative and scared. Though their dresses are dirty, it obvious they were once expensive. Zus eyes them appreciatively.
Asael... Well, well..
(BLUSHING)
Shut up. Look at this-- He has two more rifles and a large box of ammunition. Tuvia turns to Koscik's wife, deeply moved.
Thank you.
(turning away) Go.
They head for home. Zus walks beside Bella.
--and then we fell into this horrible bog. Chaya saved me. Honestly, I can't swim at all. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 40.
(MESMERIZED)
Then I will teach you!
We must have got lost a dozen times. I was absolutely resigned to die.
No...

Tell him, Chaya. Was it not the absolute worst? And that farmer, Mr. Koscik, kept making the most vulgar jokes, he said any girl who-- As they continue out of earshot, it appears as though Zus would be happy to listen for hours.

Aron and Rachel are walking through the woods. For a brie moment, viewed through the eyes of the young, we see thes woods as a magical place. Strange mushrooms, gnarled root an enormous spider's web glistening with dew.

head_text.subj: THE CAMP HAS BEGUN TO SHOW PROGRESS 72

text: Sentries are posted. Zus expertly helps with the building a bunker ("zemylanka"). There's a more permanent kitchen, a wash trough, a clothesline. Pinchas tends his goat. Though primitive and raw...a haven.

head_text.subj: SHIMON AND MALBIN ARE DIGGING A HOLE

text: Their bickering will become for them, as time goes on, a sport and a pastime.
You're trying to tell me all politics is meaningless.
In the West a monster with a little mustache, in the East a monster with a big mustache. This is all I need to know about politics.
Your messiah will have a mustache, too, and a full beard.
No. The messiahs are all in politics, and they're killing us. Zus unloads two cut and stripped trees. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 40A.
What's killing me is all your talking. Back to work. Malbin and Shimon go back to work.
And Roosevelt? He has no mustache.
My life in these woods is much easier because of Mr. Roosevelt, thank you. DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 41.

head_text.subj: WALKING THROUGH THE CAMP TUVIA AND ASAEL 73

text: review their plans.
We need to know what's going on in the villages, how the Germans patrol, who the informers are-- He realizes that Asael is not fully concentrating; instea he is watching as Chaya walks past.
Are you listening to me?
Yes.
What's her name?
Chaya. [I believe.]
(YELLING)
He waves as Chaya turns to look in their direction. Asael smiles, embarrassed.
So talk to her.
I hardly know her.
You spent three days in a cellar! Asael blushes, returns the focus to their prior conversat
Malbin says the Piznarksi granary is full. We need two guns at least...
Whose turn to go?
Zus.
You go along, just to make sure he understands my orders. Asael nods.
(re: Chaya) Go on...Go! (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 A41-41A.
Asael heads toward Chaya.

We notice a FEW NEW FACES. Their number has exceeded twen Among them are two lumbering, dark-skinned men, ARKADY an MOTL LUBCZANSKI. Ben Zion is showing Lazar and the other newcomers how to clean a weapon.
This is not a gun. It is Bar Kochba's spear. It is Ehud's sword. You fix the patch to the rod-- They do as he instructs.
--then run it through the barrel... and don't lose the patch in the
Lazar looks up, sheepishly.
I lost my patch. ARKADY LUBCZANSKI whispers contemptuously to his brother, MOTL...
The village idiot. Zus shoves Arkady out of the way and approaches Lazar, wh cowers. But rather than abuse him, Zus removes the patch from the rifle and hands it back to him.
Thank you, Zus.
(returning the rifle) It's nothing. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 42.
KISSELY is a MILKMAN with bright red hair and a bushy mustache. He leads a horse-drawn CART laden with milk can ZUS AND THE OTHERS rise up out of the ditch. In Russian:
(a pleasant tone) Good morning, friend. Getting an early start to market? Could you possibly spare us a bit of milk? Zus' tone is belied by the rifle in his hand.
This is what I'm required to give the Germans. If I don't meet my quota they'll shoot me and my family. Zus is tempted to shoot him himself.
(to Zus) Leave half. He can't go to the Germans empty-handed. Zus glares at Asael.
Tuvia's orders. Zus shakes his head, climbs onto the wagon and begins removing cartons. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 43.
(to the milkman) We are so grateful, comrade, for your cooperation. What a lovely coat. Is that a fur collar?

head_text.subj: ZUS, NOW WEARING THE MILKMAN'S COAT 77

text: joins the others lugging milk cans along the forest path.
Zus shakes his head. Lazar stands, pointing his weapon.
Lazar, you can see it's us, you idiot. You only ask, 'who goes there' when you don't know who it is.
Sorry, Zus.
is a beehive of activity. Shimon and Malbin are digging.
Even Spinoza said existence can be substantiated by empirical evidence.
All your secular learning, yet you know nothing of life.
How can you say this? Learning is my life.
And for every fact that goes in your head, another comes out your rear end. CHAYA and BELLA receive the bounty from the foragers.
Milk, eggs -- Chaya, our brave men have brought us a feast!
Blintzes! You will make me blintzes! She bestows her best smile upon him.
New arrivals are being shown around by Ben Zion. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 43A.
A MAN and WOMAN cry out with joy at an unexpected reunion (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE PINK Revision - 9-27-07 44.
ARKADY LUBCZANSKi approaches Chaya.
I don't think we've been properly introduced. Arkady Lubczanski.
Hello.
You are Chaya?
...Yes.
You are getting along all right? Anything you need? An extra blanket?
Oh. Well... Yes, that would be nice.
You'll have it by tonight. Something nice and soft. (smiles at her) I couldn't help but notice you don't have a husband yet.
(somewhat taken aback) Yet? (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 44A.
Most of the woman have already chosen. They haven't told you about this? (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 45.
No. But thank you for explaining it. She hurries away. Malbin sits down wearily beside Shimon.
Descartes at least provided for the subjective nature of experience. He takes a spoon from his sock.
Yes. You annoy me therefore I exist.
You are not eating?

By my best calculation, today is High Holiday. I am fasting. Malbin can't believe this. He rolls his eyes and digs in. One of the NEWCOMERS has brought a violin. He begins to play. A bittersweet melody. People stop talking and liste eyes filling at this reminder of a sweeter, civilized tim Ben Zion has left the new arrivals and approached Tuvia. He looks grave. Tuvia immediately knows something is wron
What is it?
The new ones, they are from Novagroduk. Your wife-- Tuvia tenses. Ben Zion hesitates...
They say...She was killed last week. (at a loss) I'm sorry. Tuvia nods. No outward display of grief. An awkward momen
Thank you for telling me. (changes the subject) We have to dig a trench around the new zemylanka. If it rains I'm afraid water will seep in. Tuvia clearly cannot deal with his news.
I'll see to it, then. (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 46.
Tuvia nods and walks away.

head_text.subj: ARON AND RACHEL WALK THROUGH THE WOODS

text: Cathedral light cuts through the trees forming visible shafts.
Jacob's ladders. Like in his dream. Asael says you can see the angels. They walk on, eventually coming upon RAILROAD TRACKS. A TRAIN is rounding the bend, headed in their direction.
Can we stay to watch?
If we hide. They move back into the trees as the train NEARS: a slow- moving engine pulling a line of WOODEN CATTLE CARS.
Is that a Nazi train?
If we had some dynamite we could blow the shit out of it.
(with undisguised

...Just like your brothers. Aron can't help but be pleased by this notion. Then, as the train passes, they can see HANDS gripping th small barred windows. And every now and then a gaunt, desperate FACE. They stare in astonishment.
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 47.
Tuvia sits alone. Outside, the SOUND of the violin continues. Shimon comes to sit beside him.
I am sorry for your loss. Tuvia nods. He is deep inside himself.
Do you want to say the Kaddish? When at last Tuvia speaks, it is almost to himself.

She was a beautiful woman. But cold. Not a day went by she didn't remind me I wasn't a good provider. For years it wasn't really a marriage at all. And now... He lowers his head. All Shimon can do is sit beside him.
Bella takes Chaya aside.
You have lipstick? Please, I know you have some left. Chaya digs in her pocket and produces a tiny remnant. Bel dabs it on and casually approaches Zus, who is on guard duty.
May I join you?
Of course.
You get lonely out here?
I like the woods. LAUGHTER and MUSIC waft through the trees.
I'm a little scared out here. Zus knows an opportunity when he sees one. He offers her drink from his bottle of vodka. (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 48.
I've never tried it.
Go ahead. She drinks, refuses to grimace. Drinks again. Zus laughs. Bella touches the rifle in his arms.
Why is there a rule against women having guns?
There aren't enough for the men.
Women need guns, too.
What for?
For protection.
Women have men for protection. Bella bites her lip. She's a virgin but also realistic.
I want protection. She steps closer and takes Zus's hand...under her coat... her breast...never taking her eyes off him.
You will take good care of me? You will be my commander.

Aron and Rachel are walking back from the train tracks. Suddenly he senses movement, freezes: ARMED POLICEMEN are advancing through the trees. Aron and Rachel bury themselves beneath piles of leaves until the police pass by, then he grabs her hand and dash
ARON RUNS through the woods like a deer. She follows. DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 49.
He bursts in, SCREAMING.

Chaos. People panic, search for family members, grab whatever th can carry, ZUS AND BELLA emerge from the woods where they have lain together for the first time. He grabs his rifle. TUVIA tries to maintain order.
Asael clutches Chaya's hand. Rounding up others.
Don't panic. THIS WAY!. GO.
THE POLICEMEN begin FIRING. TWO of the group are KILLED. Tuvia roughly pushes people deeper into the woods.
Lova, Ben Zion -- stay with us. Asael, keep them moving. Don't stop! THE POLICEMEN enter the camp. A submachine gun RAKES a shelter. KISSELY has found the escape trail into the wood
This way--
Tuvia and Zus usher the group across the river and up the embankment.

Go! Go! Move! (holding back) Isaac, keep them moving! Zus, Asael, Ben Zion... Tuvia motions for them to take defensive positions while the others escape.- The policemen emerge hurriedly through the trees and begi crossing the river. SHOTS rings out. A Policeman goes down. The German Soldie is shot in the leg. They are dragged from the water. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 49A.
An edgy silence. From the trees a VOICE calls out in Russ (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 50.

head_text.subj: LEAVE NOW AND WE WON'T SHOOT THE
DON'T BE A FOOL. THERE ARE HUNDREDS

text: The policemen exchange apprehensive looks.
The confrontation changes languages.

head_text.subj: I'M FROM KARELITZ, TOO. I LIVED BY
MAYBE I KNOW YOU. SHOW YOURSELF

text: Derisive laughter from the trees.
Give us Bielski and the rest of you can go free! Behind a tree, Tuvia is surprised by the mention of his name.
You are from Belarussia, pig! Why do you work for the Germans against your own people?
For the same reason you steal from the poor. To survive. ANOTHER SHOT RINGS OUT. Kessely is hit in the arm.
Shit.
Next one is to the head! (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 51.
Soon it will be dark... See how you find your way home then! The policemen are having similar thoughts.
Soon it's a full-scale retreat.
Tuvia, Zus, Lova & Ben Zion emerge. Zus picks up the dead German's machine pistol.
They'll be back. (looks around) We have to find a new camp.
Next time just draw them a map.
What does that mean?
It means -- we should have killed the fucking milkman. Your policy of diplomacy is shit. Zus is breathing hard, full of the adrenaline of battle.
...Two are dead. Winter is coming and now we have no shelter. Why? Because you don't have the stomach to do what must be done. He walks away.
DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 52.

head_text.subj: THE NOVEMBER WIND WHISTLES THROUGH THE BARE FOREST

text: as the group trudges along -- weighed down by cooking gea food, guns, etc. Asael takes the iron cauldron from Chaya Zus and Bella walk side-by-side. Pinchas leads his goat.
Where is he taking us? My feet are going to fall off.
A great rabbi once said, "wherever I go, I am always going to the land of Israel."
Well, maybe rabbis should give better directions. Tuvia walks alongside but apart.
The group is sprawled on the ground. Four people share a single cigarette. Shimon and Malbin hardly have the energ to argue. Pinchas feeds his goat. Tuvia walks among them.
Rest and eat. I need volunteers for a scouting party. Zus raises his hand. Tuvia nods in grudging gratitude. However mixed his feelings, Zus can always be counted on.
Tuvia looks at Zus, who shrugs. They are in unfamiliar territory. As they move cautiously forward:

head_text.subj: A MAN IN A RED ARMY TUNIC

text: steps into the path, holding an automatic rifle. He WHIST softly. More ARMED MEN materialize, surrounding them.
(in Russian; subtitles)
Tuvia instantly grasps the situation. He salutes.
(in Russian; subtitles) A brigade of independent fighters searching for our comrades. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 52A.
Zus almost does a double-take at Tuvia's bluff.
What brigade? (CONTINUED)
YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 53.
We belong to the Bielski otriad.
We know of you. Jewish bandits. Zus's finger tightens on the trigger of his submachine gu
I'll take the two on the left... Tuvia maintains his composure.
I'm sure we can clear up this misunderstanding with your commander.

A primitive tent camp. RUSSIAN PARTISANS move about, quie and cold-eyed men wearing remnants of Red Army uniforms. Zus can't help but be impressed by the array of weaponry. VICTOR PACHENKO emerges from a tent. A former lieutenant, dashing in a fur cap and long officer's coat. He addresse them in Russian.
I am Viktor Panchenko, commander of the October otriad. We have had complaints of a Jewish gang stealing from villages loyal to us. (a steely look) How do you respond to these charges?
When you take food it is from loyal supporters. When we do, you call it stealing.
We are soldiers.
And we fight a common enemy. The motherland doesn't distinguish between Jews and non-Jews. Viktor is amused by this bit of Soviet dogma.
But Jews do not fight. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 54.
These Jews do. Viktor appraises Tuvia for a moment.
We will see. Select your best fighters and send them to us. Zus looks at Tuvia, knowing he has no choice.
We are honored to be of service. Tuvia and Zus SALUTE and head back the way they came.
(under his breath) So we're partisans now.
As if we have a choice.
Has taken root. People hard at work building zemylanka.
Tuvia and Malbin are working together on a new bunker. Malbin expertly nails a header across a doorway.
(throwing a smaller
Here.
If my friends at The New Socialists' Club could see me now... (shakes his head) I haven't read a book in months.
I haven't read one in years. Malbin looks up from his work.
I wasn't a very good student. You can ask Shimon.
.I did. Tuvia laughs ruefully. Considers him for a moment.
Yet you accept me as Commander. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 55.
Malbin thinks about it for a moment.
Who else? Tuvia nods. Good point. They continue working.
Might I make an observation? Tuvia gestures, go ahead.
We need to be strong, but--
Other things are important, too.
Such as? Malbin tries to think how best to put it.
Community. Tuvia considers the word. As if trying it on for size.
You have more ideas? About all this?
...A few.
I'm listening...

head_text.subj: MEANWHILE, THE WOMEN WATCH AS ASAEL LEADS IN NEW ARRIV

text: More mouths to feed.
More young bodies to keep us warm. One ot them, a young man, YITZHAK SHULMAN, RIPS the yello Star-of-David off his coat and kneels to KISS THE GROUND.
Which one is Tuvia Bielski? Someone points Tuvia out. Shulman hurries over and kisses Tuvia's hand. Zus is drinking nearby with his cronies. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 55A.
None of us knew if you really existed. I am from Baranowicze. They are going to liquidate the ghetto. Chaya bursts into tears. Asael puts his arm around her.
My parents-- Zus catches Tuvia's glance to Malbin. Tuvia turns back to Shulman.
We'll do what we can. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 56.
Shulman tries to kiss Tuvia's hand once again, but Tuvia takes his hand, instead, and shakes it. CHAYA looks deeply into Asael's eyes.
You will help my parents?
I've seen you looking at me. If you were to rescue them, I would do... anything...you-- Asael is completely undone by the starkness of this.
No. I mean, yes. All right.
and grabs him as he walks away. Their hushed tones belie the growing chasm between them. (CONTINUED)
GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 57.
And what exactly does that mean, 'do what we can.'
We must send for whoever is left alive.
And if it is a hundred? Six hundred?
Then we will provide.
And when the Germans follow these hundreds and slaughter us.
I won't let that happen. Tuvia exchanges a glance with Malbin. Zus catches it. He has sensed Malbin's growing influence.
You won't let that happen.
No. I'll bring them out myself.
From the ghetto.
Yes.
Pan Tuvia. Rabbi Tuvia. Allow me to kiss your hand... Tuvia tries to pull his hand away, but Zus holds him.
You think Pachenko wants hundreds more of us in the forest?
I cannot have you contradicting me... Not when others are around. (looks around) Our family must stick together. (CONTINUED)
TAN Revision - 9-10-07 58.
And who is it that's risking our family, and for what? For the sake of these-- (gestures at the new
--Malbushim.
Don't call them that.
That's who comes to us from the ghetto. Empty clothes. Bloodsuckers.
They are people. Jews.

Pretentious Jews. Jews who stuck up their noses and wouldn't give us the time of day when we passed them on the street. Jews who went out of their way to keep their daughters locked away from our dirty hands. (SAVAGELY)
You think your old teacher will give you a good grade because you saved his worthless ass! They accept you as their leader only because they are too weak and full of shit to help themselves.
--What about Bella? Tuvia looks over at Bella, who is anxiously watching.
--You think she'd be with you if it wasn't for what is happening here? Zus glares at him, but tries to control himself.
--Is it love Zus? (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 59.
Zus is sick of talk. He PUNCHES Tuvia in the face. Tuvia is rocked but still he goads his brother.

You are the man of her dreams? The Romeo of Novagrudok? Zus can't take anymore. He charges Tuvia, who sidesteps and SLAMS him in the gut. All the frustration of the past months, not to mention years of sibling rivalry, translat into fists and elbows. Ben Zion moves to break it up. Tuvia and Zus turn on him.

Is this your business? Zus gains the upper hand and starts to beat the crap put Tuvia. Finally, in desperation Tuvia rolls away and picks up a rock. He is about to slam it into his brother's head when suddenly he stops himself. The two brothers look at each other, both breathing heavi realizing that they have crossed some line.
(calls out) Ben Zion. Krensky. Lova. Israel. Let's go. (to Tuvia) We are going to join the real partisans. He looks at Asael.
Are you coming? Asael looks at one brother, then the other. Once again, h is in the middle. He looks at Chaya, then back at Zus.
No.
Good. I'll dance at your wedding. He stops by Bella's side, touches her arm, then disappear down the trail. The others follow.
Tuvia and Asael feel naked outside the safety of the fore In the distance the city looms.
Tuvia and Asael pass by the barbed wire and machine-guns the guards and dogs manning the barrier to the ghetto. GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 59A.

head_text.subj: THE WALLS OF THE NOVOGRUDOK GHETTO 96

text: Tuvia and Asael climb over a dilapidated wall. DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 60.

head_text.subj: THE DESERTED STREETS OF THE GHETTO 97

text: People peer out from behind shuttered windows. Others hur to get off the street. Tuvia consults a hand-drawn map.
This way.
Zus, Lova and Ben Zion march alongside the Russians Partisans. DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 61.
that might once have been home to a family-of-four now HO fifteen. Tuvia and Asael are deep in conversation with several ELDERS of the ghetto Council

We are not so naive as to believe they won't kill some of us. But all the Jews? It makes no sense. They need us to work. In the factories. The labor camps. Tuvia notices A PRETTY GIRL standing on a chair in order hear. Her name is LILKA and we will soon come to know her (CONTINUED)
YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 62.
There are rumors. Of death camps.

We too have heard of such places. But have you seen them yourself? Can you tell me, with absolute certainty, that we are not just as likely to die out there with you in the woods with Winter coming on...? Someone WHISTLES from the street below. A tense moment. Another whistle. All clear.

--Do you think we haven't all considered running away? For every one that leaves they kill twenty. How can I sacrifice thousands for the sake of a few?" Tuvia looks at them, rubbing his face in concentration.
What if we were to take all of you?
The old, the sick? There are thousands. How will we live?
We will protect you. We have made alliances with the Russian Partisans.
They are as bad as the Nazi's. You are too young to know the pogroms-- (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 63-63A.
Tuvia SLAMS HIS FIST on a table.

YOU WANT TIME? Fine, I give you a day. A month. Maybe a year. To live! (to an older couple) Your daughter is out there with us. (to another woman) Your husband is waiting for you. An old orthodox RABBI stands nearby.
Rabbi?
We...are waiting for God. Tuvia looks at him in disbelief. Such madness is incontrovertible. A suspended moment.
I am going. This breaks the log jam. Several others join in, "We are coming," "Us, too," etc. Tuvia nods his acknowledgment.

head_text.subj: A COURTYARD IN THE NOVOGRUDOK GHETTO

text: A crude tunnel has been dug through a ghetto wall. PEOPLE squeeze through into the adjoining alley. Behind them, a hundred more await their turn. Out in the alley, Asael stops them momentarily as a car goes by at the end of the street, then gives the all-clea Tuvia takes Lilka' hand and helps her pass through. Their eyes meet for just a moment.
(CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 63B-63C.

The new ARRIVALS file in. Men wear citified coats and som women have furs. They eye the veterans, thinking, 'how dirty they are'; the veterans eye them warily, wondering, 'How will we feed them?' A handmade sign reads, "New Jerusalem." Chaya is re-unite with her parents. She holds Asael's arm and looks up at him with absolute rapture. She is his. Malbin is collecting valuables. One WELL-DRESSED WOMAN is reluctant to part with her jewelry.
But they were my grandmother's... (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 64.
And now they belong to the otriad. Everyone sacrifices for the sake of the collective. We can trade these for food or weapons. Next... Nearby, Shimon is INTERVIEWING another line of arrivals.
--How about carpenters? Any bootmakers? Seamstresses?
I am an accountant.
(DEADPAN)
That should come in handy. Next...
I am a nurse.
Ahhh...welcome. And you, tateh? OPPENHEIM is an old man with thick glasses.
I am a watchmaker. Tuvia has walked over to observe.
Can you repair guns?
Guns? No.

(hands him a rifle) See if you can fix this trigger. Oppenheim slips on a pair of spectacles and studies the mechanism. It sticks. He digs into his pocket and produce a small file and expertly begins to shave the metal spur. He tests it, then hands it back to Tuvia, who CLICKS the trigger.
You have a new profession. A murmur of appreciation ripples through the group as Shu appears -- leading A MAGNIFICENT WHITE HORSE. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 65.
Look what we found running free. Must have belonged to an aristocrat.

My God, she's beautiful. (strokes her flanks) May I? He mounts her easily, urges her around the perimeter, greeting the new arrivals. Heads turn as he trots past. He is the center of attention, and he knows it. And likes it.

Friends, we are happy to see you safely among us. But there are many things you must learn about living here... All attention turns to him. The Lubczanski brothers grumb to each other, none too pleased with Tuvia's show-boating
Once you are settled, you'll be assigned work duties. Everyone works, no exceptions.
Of people being introduced to various tasks: shoemaking, sewing, cooking. Asael teaching them to use guns.
We will help supply the Russian Partisans by making clothes, repairing guns.
Malbin catches his eye and winks -- clearly this has been part of their "strategy" discussions.
Women will learn to use weapons and fight alongside men. Tuvia takes a rifle from Asael and holds it aloft.

This is not a gun. It is Bar Kochba's spear. It is Ehud's sword. You will all learn to protect yourselves. A LITTLE BOY holds Lilka's hand and looks up at Tuvia in wonder. He cuts an iconic figure. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 65A.
(to Lilka) He is a Jew? Lilka is equally struck -- although there is something mo than wonder in her regard. She nods.
Pregnancies are forbidden. We cannot accommodate an infant's needs. Our bunkers are overcrowded so you will have to build new ones. He looks out over the sea of expectant faces.
(CONTINUING)

...This is the one place in all of Belorussia where a Jew can be free. (looks out over them) We will make again, here in this forest, the life that was taken from you. We welcome you into our community. DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 66.
when Riva stops him.
You are Tuvia Bielski? You are really him? (Tuvia nods
You are a hero. A Maccabee. She vigorously shakes Tuvia's hand and walks away. Tuvia catches his reflection in the water. And likes it.

Lilka awakens to find TEN WOMEN wedged in beside her -- back to front -- like spoons. Idly, she begins to ITCH her scalp. Then her leg. In the pale morning light she sees that she is crawling with lic She SCREAMS. The women around her wake up, terrified.
Get them off! Get them off me!
What? Where?
Lice need somewhere to sleep, too. The others LAUGH, but Lilka is on the verge of hysteria. She stumbles out, stepping on several others as she goes.
Crying, she tears at her clothes -- only to discover Tuvi and OTHERS staring at her with interest. She is mortified
THE WOMEN wash clothes in the stream. Lilka is by the riverbank, scrubbing furiously. Tamara works beside her.
You get rid of them quicker if you boil them. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 66A.
Lilka is grateful for this bit of camp wisdom.
Tamara, come on in, it's freezing and slimy and horrible. Tamara shakes her head, no.
So modest...
... So last night I dreamed I was taking a real bath. With hot water.
And soap. (CONTINUED)
YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 66B.
And bubbles.
Oh, take me to that dream!
I was dreaming of shoes...
Shoes, Riva?

There was a man in a shop on Grudek street... and the way he caressed my feet when I tried on his shoes... Riva swoons. The women burst into ribald laughter. The SOUND of a horse. They look to the opposite bank where: TUVIA RIDES BY on his horse. Lilka can't help but stare.
Doesn't take a fortune teller to know what Lilka's dreaming about... Lilka blushes furiously. The women laugh even louder.

head_text.subj: A FLAT STRETCH OF TRAIN TRACK 103

text: Gramov shows Zus how to plant a disk-like CONTACT MINE.
--buried underneath with this
(indicates a finger- like protrusion) --almost touching the rail. As the train passes, its weight causes pressure on the detonator, and then-- (very loud; in English)
Zus falls over, startled. Gramov laughs. Partisan humor. DOUBLE YELLOW Revision - 10-8-07 67.
Chaya is on kitchen detail with Tamara.

Yesterday, potatoes with beets, Today, beets with potatoes. Special treat tomorrow...potato soup. With beets. Not far away, Arkady and several others have created a primitive still -- turning potatoes into vodka.
We love potatoes, don't we, boys! Here, put some hair on your chest! They give Aron his first taste.
Bella is walking, arm in arm, with Asael.

So...a little bird told me that a certain someone is waiting...for another certain someone to ask a certain question... Go on... She indicates Chaya by wiggling her eyebrows in her direction. Asael shakes his head but heads in that direction.
Asael "happens" to bump into Chaya.
Hello, Chaya.
Hello, Asael.
May...I help you?
Wash clothes? I... don't think so. An awkward moment as he stands there watching her.
Chaya... I...was...wondering...if... maybe...you...I mean... you and I-- (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 67A.
I accept.
You do?
I do.
Asael and Chaya are getting married. A LIGHT SNOW is fall as they say repeat their vows as Shimon instructs. Their breath condenses in the cold.
Behold thou art consecrated unto me by this ring according to the Laws of Moses and Israel. But rather than a ring, Asael gives her a shiny new rifle As the ceremony continues, we:

Zus, Ben Zion and several BIELSKI FIGHTERS hide alongside TEN RUSSIAN PARTISANS as a GERMAN TROOP TRUCK approaches. Pachenko watches as Zus follows the approaching truck thr binoculars, then cocks the heavy machine gun. The truck SLOWS TO A CRAWL as it encounters an overturned PEASANT CART blocking the road.

As Asael kisses the bride, Tuvia is staring not at the newlyweds but rather at Lilka, who has washed and let dow her hair. She glances up and meets his eye, then looks away. As Asael crushes the traditional glass underfoot:
The driver SLUMPS over the wheel and the truck careens la off the road. GERMAN SOLDIERS spill out, blindly returning fire as Zus' fighters SWARM down the hill. Several are HIT right away.

People dance and sing, their joy juxtaposed with the murderous intensity of the firefight, their twirling movements a cracked mirror of the death agonies of fighte of both sides as they are hit and fall. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 67B.
Some of the inexperienced Jewish fighters freeze, some fi their weapons blindly. Ben Zion does well. ZUS RUNS AMONG THEM, fiercely EXHORTING them to attack.
Get up! Move! SHOOT OR I'LL SHOOT YOU...

head_text.subj: FROM A VANTAGE POINT IN THE ROCKS

text: Viktor watches, heartened by Zus' natural aggression. GERMAN SOLDIERS TAKE COVER behind the overturned truck effectively RETURNING FIRE. Several partisans are KILLED. ZUS PULLS A POTATO MASHER GRENADE from his belt and RUNS THE TRUCK in a mad headlong assault.

He ROLLS THE GRENADE under the truck and dives away as it EXPLODES. The remaining Germans RAISE THEIR HANDS. CHEERING PARTISANS leap into the truck, capturing an arse of rifles and ammo. THE JEWISH FIGHTERS join in the looti Boots, coats, blankets, etc. Zus approaches the wounded and captured German prisoners, kneeling in surrender, hands behind their necks. Without hesitation, he shoots them, point-blank, one afte another. VIKTOR approaches Zus, who salutes.
You are related to Bielski?
I am a Bielski, too. Viktor looks at him appraisingly.
Indeed. He walks away. Zus has found a home.
as SNOW continues to fall. The young marriage is a celebration of hope over despair.
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 68.
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 69.
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 70.

SNOW covers the camp. A driving wind. Bundled in scarves, overcoats and as many layers as they can wear, Bella and Chaya break ice in a pot. Tamara takes FROZEN LAUNDRY fro a line. In a bunker, Malbin and Shimon shiver under a shared blan Women and children stare blankly into space. Riva unwraps rags from a man's foot and examines his toes BLACK with frostbite. Asael and Tuvia are making their rounds. They pass Aron and Rachel who have built a snowman which they top off by adding a German helmet with a bullet hole in it.
Asael shows Tuvia the last few potatoes.
There is talk of returning to the  ghetto.
Madness.
They've barely eaten in days. Even when our food missions manage to get through, there are armed patrols. Farmers who once helped us now guard their barns with shotguns. Tuvia considers for a moment.

Send out more missions. And bring shotguns. Tuvia sets off. In every face he passes, there's misery and accusation in the shivering bodies and trembling blue lips. Children stare at him with sunken, haunted eyes.
Tuvia visits his beautiful horse. He unties him.
A whisper runs through the group..."meat"..."what kind?". Where'd it come from?" Tuvia watches them eat hungrily.
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 71.
Snow falling outside. Several partisans are singing. Zus is drinking heavily with Viktor; they take pinches of sal with each swallow. Viktor finishes a bottle, tosses it.
Another dead soldier! Zus looks at him, bleary-eyed, confused. Viktor explains:
More dead soldiers than empty bottles.
(slurring his words) That is so...Russian. He cracks open another bottle and takes a big slug.
At least you drink like one.
'A Jew can't drink, a Jew can't fight.' What is it we are good at, Viktor? Dying. That is what we are good at.
So tell me about this brother of yours...
.Asael?
You are such an idiot. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 71A.
I know who you mean... The Great Tuvia Bielski. Savior of the Jews and all around Big Shit.
You compete with him.
He competes with me.
My older brother and I have the same relationship.
He is a Big Shit also?
A soldier. (a long moment) He was killed in the first hour of the German invasion. This sobers them up a bit.
LILKA is shivering, her eyes inward and unfocused.
Lilka?
Sorry, Tuvia. I was...thinking. It's nothing. He looks at her intently, knowing there's more.
...Every time new people come into camp, I keep hoping... even though, I know... (her teeth are
...I'm sorry.
Everyone here has lost someone. She looks up at him, helpless to be so revealed.
You too?
(a small nod) Here... He takes off his wool coat and puts it around her shoulde (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 71B.
No. Today I go on my first food mission. Tuvia's order has consigned her to this dangerous duty.
I will have Asael send someone else.
No. I must go now. I want to go. She is clearly scared but desperate not to show it. He reaches into his belt and hands her a revolver.
You know how to use this? She nods. Leaving, she passes the Lubczanski brothers, wh are on their way in. DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 72.
She is a tasty one, your aristocrat.
She is not my aristocrat.
No? We were told, 'hands off,' property of the Commander. Tuvia just stares, daring him to continue.
Tuvia walks past the now-empty stable heading into the wo A voice calls out of the misty snow.
Lazar. I am coming from camp. The danger is from those coming to camp.
(SHEEPISH)
Sorry, Tuvia... (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 73.
No sign of the food mission?
Not yet. Tuvia looks anxiously into the deep woods.
Lilka and Shulman are walking backwards, retracing their steps to obscure their footprints in the drifting snow.
We mustn't have any tracks leading back to base. He loads two sacks of food onto her shoulders.
Stay on this side of the creek until you reach the river then up the hill. (points the way) I'll wait here for the others. She nods and trudges on toward camp through waist-deep sn
As they head toward a zemylanka, Riva is briefing Tuvia o the sick. Every now and then, he glances toward the woods
--several cases of pneumonia... Also I'm beginning to see signs of scurvy. No one's had a vegetable in weeks.
Tuvia! Lazar is dragging a WOUNDED MAN back into camp.
Bring him to the infirmary. Tuvia glances back toward the woods. Looks at his watch.
...Shulman will look after her. He looks up. She looks at him sympathetically. Apparently his interest in Lilka isn' quite as secret as he imagines
Exhausted, cold and alone, Lilka is becoming increasingly disoriented in a snowy landscape where every tree looks (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 73A.
alike. She turns in a circle, trying to decide which way to go. A MANGY DOG appears out of nowhere, its coat matted, its ribs showing, a wild look in its eye. It GROWLS ferocious
Shoo-- Shoo-- (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 74.

But the dog, as ravenous as she, smells the food and won' back down. It inches forward, FOAMING at the mouth. Lilka tries to step back but the dog LUNGES, snapping its jaws. It's terrifying. She looks desperately for help. Suddenly the dog LEAPS at her. She turns away and it rips a sack from her shoulder, knocking her down. Viciously it begins tearing the sack apart in search of the food withi A SHOT RINGS OUT. The dog drops. Lilka holds the smoking gun in two hands. Grimly, she poc the weapon, picks up the sack of food, and starts off. Reconsidering, she walks back and hoists the dead dog ont her shoulder, too. More food.
Riva bandages Edjelman's head. Tuvia looks at all the sic
What's wrong with them all?
If it's typhus we're in trouble. The lice are carriers.
The partisans have ampicillin. But they say they need it for themselves. In the background Lilka enters, face scratched, blood sme hands and arms -- like some kind of primitive huntress.
(sees he is distracted) Tuvia...
Medicine for typhus. I heard you. I'll go see Viktor right away. On his way out, he passes Lilka, who is being looked afte
Are you all right?
Fine. (handing him the gun) Thank you. Tuvia can clearly see that she is shaken -- but he has no time to ask more. He has to find out about the medicine.
I must go. SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 75.
Viktor, Gramov and Zus are poring over a map of the area.
--and every time we try to move, they radio back to police HQ which houses the transmitter...here.
--So we attack the transmitter.
Yes, yes, my Hebrew warrior. Except for the troops in Stankiewcze and the machine guns out front. THE TENT FLAP OPENS. Tuvia enters. He has developed a cou
Two Bielski's in one room! To what do we owe this honor?
We have sickness. I need ampicillin.
This medicine is reserved for fighters.
If typhus breaks out in our camp, it may spread to yours.
I will have to take that chance. Zus looks from one immovable force to the other.
I must insist. Comrade.
You'd better not. Zus is watching this dick-measuring with keen interest.
There would be medicine in the police headquarters at Stankiewcze, yes? (CONTINUED)
BLUE Revision - 6-26-07 76.
He looks to Gramov, who looks to Viktor, who nods.
Tuvia and I grew up there. (looks at Tuvia) Perhaps the Bielski otriad will volunteer to take out the transmitter. Viktor looks from Zus to Tuvia.
Of course. Zus grabs his submachine gun.
Krensky, Ben Zion. Let's go.
is quiet at midnight on this snowy evening.
Tuvia and Zus sit in the cab of an old truck, its exhaust sending plumes of condensation into the freezing night.
Well... He looks into the back where the others wait, anxiously clutching their weapons. Tuvia tries to hold back a cough
Stay with the truck. And make sure it's in gear when we get back.
I'm going in with you.
I give the orders tonight. Across the square, the police station looms.
You don't have to do this.
I don't? (a bitter laugh) What about the typhus? (CONTINUED)
PINK Revision - 7-18-07 77.
So more die. They will anyway. A grim smile from Zus. Tuvia is broken up inside.
I have been given this mission by my superior officer. He starts to get out the cab. Tuvia reaches into his pock takes out the mezuzah that once blessed their parents' ho

Zus... (hands him the mezuzah) For luck. Zuz pockets it and joins the others creeping into the shadows. But rather than follow them into the police station, we HOLD on Tuvia's face. Suddenly we HEAR The sound of gunfi Then nothing. Ten seconds. More gunfire. Twenty. It is excruciating. Thirty. The longest CLOSE-UP in film histor

head_text.subj: FLASHES OF WHAT IS HAPPENING INSIDE... 117

text: Ben Zion bursts in and opens fire, killing two policemen. Krensky jumps the counter and smashes the transmitter. A policeman appears behind them on the stairs and shoots Krensky in the back. Ben Zion whirls and kills him.

head_text.subj: 117A TUVIA WANTS TO HELP. HE PULLS HIS GUN, UNLOCKS THE D
OPENS IT. STOPS. HE HAS PROMISED TO WAIT WITH THE TRUCK.

text: Zus, meanwhile, rummages cabinets, looking for ampicillin
Let's GO! In the back room, Zus keeps rummaging. A window EXPLODES. Ben Zion is hit. Mortally wounded, he sinks to his knees, returning fire as Zus reappears.
as Zus bursts out the door. He races to the truck and struggles into the passenger seat, BLEEDING FROM HIS SHOULDER.
Go. GO!
What about the others?! (CONTINUED)
PINK Revision - 7-18-07 77A.
From his coat Zus takes out a BLOOD-SOAKED PACKAGE. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 78.
Medicine.
The others?
Fighters die so that malbushim may live, that's what you believe, yes? Tuvia absorbs the accusation as if taking a punch.
So you're a communist now, Zus? Zus lays his head back on the seat, closes his eyes.
Communist, Zionist, Manicurist, what difference does it make? You got your medicine.
Come back to us. Zus won't look at him.
You are my brother.
So you remember.

head_text.subj: A MOURNER'S CIRCLE IN THE TREES 120

text: for Ben Zion and Krensky. Shimon addresses the group.
Merciful God, we commit our friends Ben Zion and Krensky to your care. We have no more prayers, no more tears. We have run out of blood. Choose another people We PAN PAST the familiar faces.

We have paid for each of your Commandments. We have covered every field and stone with ashes. Sanctify another land. (looks at them) Choose another people. Teach them the Deeds and the Prophecies. Grant us but one more blessing -- Take back the gift of our holiness. YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 79.
Tuvia is still drinking heavily. He is COUGHING STEADILY, his face sweaty with fever. The SOUND of angry voices from outside the bunker.
Arkady Lubczanski has pulled a knife on Asael, who backs away, STUMBLING into a group of bystanders.
Next time, I cut off your nose, pisher. Tuvia emerges from his bunker. He is weaving a bit and hi words are slurred.
Whassa problem, Arkady?
Those who risk their lives to bring back food deserve a larger portion than those who risk nothing.
Everyone gets the same portion.
Not when you're serving, pisher. I see you digging to the bottom of the pot for your little forest cutie and her parents...
She is my wife!
Policy is...Same for all. If someone is stealing he'll face consequences. Asael is astonished that Tuvia would go against him in pu and embarrassed by his public drunkenness.
What consequences? Others are closely watching this test of Tuvia's authorit
Reduced rations for one week. (a beat) Both of you. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 80.
(in his face)
Arkady is tempted to take him on. But he backs down.
(raises his voice) This matter is settled. Everybody back in line. People are staring at him.
His eyes meet Lilka's. She looks away. Asael takes Tuvia' arm and pulls him aside.
Tuvia, I would never--
Yes. I know.
Then why am I to be punished...? Tuvia just takes another swallow from his bottle.
Fischer is with them. So is Levine. On food missions, they take first for themselves and only bring back what's left over-- Tuvia's head is throbbing. He closes his eyes.
