--and they spread rumors, that you are power-hungry and corrupt, that you take whatever woman you choose-- (Tuvia can't help but laugh) --that we keep gold for ourselves, and that-- He stops himself.
--What? (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 81.
...that you drink too much and are no longer fit to lead us.
.Maybe they're right. Asael looks at him. No longer the brother he once idealiz
Zus would have punched him senseless.
Zus.
I miss him.
He has made his choice. He reels away toward the woods.
Tuvia is lying in his bunker, vomiting and burning up wit fever. Shimon has brought him soup.
Drink this. (WINKS)
From the bottom of the pot. Tuvia can barely get the soup down.
...the way they look at me... with their pasty faces. Let them starve, we're all going to die out here anyway.
Not easy being the big boss. Moses was a lonely man when he led us out of bondage.
...Moses.
So I'm a sucker for a biblical allusion. But what is society without leaders. Without leaders, we falter. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 81A.
I am not a leader.
Neither was Moses, but somehow that seemed to work out.
Several partisans are singing a drinking song while Zus silently soaks his feet in a bucket. Lova walks in. His face is black and blue.
Lova, what happened? Who did this? Lova sits and buries his head in his hands.
Lova. Tell me. Who?
Gramov. Two others. I used the officer's latrine.
For this they beat you? Lova is trying not to weep.
They said they wouldn't shit in the same hole as a Jew. Zus gets to his feet.
Zus bursts in to find Panchenko deep in conversation with Gramov and others. They look up at the intrusion.
Forgive me, Commander.
Zus. Join us. He offers him a glass of vodka. Zus doesn't take it.
I want to report the mistreatment of a comrade. Gramov looks up. Zus meets his eye. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 81B.
This man beat Comrade Lova -- for no reason at all.
I had a perfectly good reason. He is a Jew. The other men LAUGH. Panchenko frowns at Gramov.
--and you are an ignorant Tartar. (offers Zus vodka) Ignore him. Here...
Anti-semitism is a violation of Party discipline. Panchenko sighs. Does he really have to deal with this?
He's right, Gramov. Apologize to the Jew.
I apologize, Jew.
There. You see? (...a command) Now drink up. Zus doesn't know what to do. He accepts the vodka.
Guards ring the snowy perimeter.

head_text.subj: THE BLURRED IMAGE OF AN ANGEL FRAMED BY A HALO OF SUN

text: as it swims into focus. Tuvia opens his eyes. It is Lilka She sits beside him, mopping his forehead with a cool rag
Your fever broke in the night. The medicine helped.
How long was I asleep?
Two days. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 81C-83.
And you've nursed me the whole time?
Chaya helped.
Did you study nursing at university?
We devoted ourselves to more essential knowledge -- like Greek Philosophy and Latin. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 84.
I never went to university.
What kind of work did you do? Before.
My wife's father had a store. Before the Race Laws. (looks at her) She is is dead.
I'm sorry.
Tell me more about university.
It all feels like a dream. I spent months trying to master Chopin's nocturnes.
I'd love to hear you play.
You know Chopin?
Who doesn't? Chopin the butcher from Novogrudok.
(LAUGHS)
If you're well enough to tease me, you're well enough to eat. I'll see what's for supper. She gets up to go.
Thank you, Lilka.

THE LUBCZANSKI'S have taken the fullest advantage of Tuvi illness. There are now TWO LINES of people waiting for food. The malbushim line up like prison inmates. Lazar looks in his bowl -- two beans floating in a scummy broth.
Motl, Arkady, Fischer, Levine and a few others are enjoyi real food. Lazar calls out from the other line. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 85.
Hey, Arkady This isn't soup, it's piss.

I will piss on your head and you  will say it's raining. Eat it.  The rest of Lubczanski's cabal laughs. TUVIA emerges from his bunker. The first thing he sees is Asael, whose face is BATTERED AND SWOLLEN.
What happened? Asael just looks over at the food line -- where Arkady ha grabbed Chaya by the waist -- to the delight of the other Tuvia strides over to them.
What is this?
New policy. Fighters get better food.
Against my orders...
You are no longer Commander. Sorry. Tuvia nods, considering his remark for a moment.

head_text.subj: AND THEN TAKES OUT HIS PISTOL AND SHOOTS ARKADY IN THE CH

text: He then turns the gun on Motl and the others -- they literally cower in fear. He raises his voice to those watching.
As long as I am the leader of this group, you will obey my commands.

head_text.subj: THERE WILL BE NO MORE COMPLAINING

text: THEY LEAVE. NOW! The rest work.  Every morning we get up and we work.  WE WORK. In the snow and the cold  and the dark. Tomorrow we begin to  build ten new zemylanka, we double  the number of food missions.  ...We work. (looks down at Arkady) Take his body into the woods and leave it for the wolves. He turns and walks away. As he passes the food lines, peo subtly move out of his way and whisper after he is gone. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 85A.
Whereas once he was greeted warmly by all, now his isolat is complete.  He is the Commander. DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 86.
Tripping over roots, and finally leaning against a tree, is mumbling, almost incoherent -- part prayer, part profanity.
struggles through patches of snow. Ice drips from branche
Takes a group portrait. The forest is green again.
on the women's bodies as they bathe in the river.
Who has the soap? I know there was a little left?
Use the sand. It's good for your skin.
And what skin! And already married, too! Bella laughs. Chaya splashes her playfully with water.
I've turned into a skeleton.
And you were always so worried about staying slim.
When we get out of this forest I am going to eat only cake and grow as big as a house. Tamara appears. She's wearing a long overcoat.
Join us. At least the sun is warm. (Tamara turns away; Lilka joins her) Tamara?
I can't, Lilka... (lowers her voice) I'm pregnant. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 86A.
I had no idea.
I've kept it hidden for months but now it's obvious. No one can know. They move away from the others. Tamara shows her.
It could come any day. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 87.
..Who is the father?

I--- It was when I was escaping. A man with a gun stopped me. I thought he was a Partisan. He told me to follow him and he took me to this place... The memory overwhelms her. She begins to break down.
Inside me something broke....I wanted to die. Every night I have nightmares -- what will happen when Tuvia finds out.
He will understand.
No. You mustn't tell him!
I won't. Don't worry. (touches her arm) What are you going to do? Tamara's eyes fill with a new resolve.
I feel this new life inside me. It's the only thing keeping me going. I won't give it up, I'll kill myself. Lilka puts her arm around her.
From his belt hang the pelts of two dead rabbits. He hears A SOUND. Three GERMAN SOLDIERS are putting camouflage on their helmets. Beyond, A GERMAN ARMORED COLUMN. The assault is coming.
where Shimon and Malbin are playing chess. Shimon has developed a bad cough.
You call that a move?
I call it an inevitable conclusion based on unimpeachable reasoning. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 A87.
The question, my friend the Genius, is what are you going to do about it. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 87A.
I'm thinking about what I'm going to do about it.
Aha! I got him!
You didn't get me. You think you got me? How about this?
(GOBSMACKED)
Who would make a move like that?
A genius maybe. Tuvia has been listening nearby. Aron races into the camp
Tuvia... We SEE Aron whispering in Tuvia's ear. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 88.
(calls out) Asael! Asael comes running.
Get a message to Zus. He's got to tell Viktor they're coming.
Tuvia stands peering out into the forest. Asael joins him
Lazar spotted another patrol. They're getting closer. Tuvia nods. Suddenly, he HEARS a strange sound. An animal
Do you hear that?

We HEAR the SOUND for what it is... The cry of a newborn. A baby boy in this mud manger. Riva and Lilka have assist Tamara holds her new baby to her breast. Suddenly -- the blanket serving as a door is SWEPT ASIDE. TUVIA stands there. Tamara cries out and shields the baby Lilka springs up and pushes him back outside.
Tuvia walks angrily. Lilka keeps up.
She promises not to take extra food...
This is against my orders.
So you are going to shoot her, too? Tuvia stares at her. He has never seen this side of her.
Please, Tuvia. The baby is all she has to live for.
I cannot allow it. He turns away. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE SALMON Revision - 10-21-07 88A.
Lilka SPINS him around, surprising him with her strength and the strength of her passion. (CONTINUED)
PINK Revision - 7-18-07 89.
You must let it live!
I cannot keep the living alive. Tamara and the man who fathered this child are responsible for its fate.
She was raped by the Nazis. Tuvia closes his eyes. He is tired of being in charge, tired of being the arbiter of other peoples' fate.

...You tell us to hold onto our humanity. Not to become like animals. What better way than by bringing a life into this world of suffering and death. It's our only hope. Tuvia is undone by her intensity. The very nearness of her. The smell of her newly-washed hair. The glow of her skin. He looks at her. And nods in surrender.
Thank you, Tuvia. She kisses him. A chaste kiss of gratitude. She pulls back and they look into each other's eyes. The next kiss is something entirely different.
Lilka...
I knew what was expected of the women here -- yet you never touched me...
Shhh..
I'm not afraid of anything, Tuvia. I'm not even afraid of you. They kiss deeply.
Lilka lies in his arms. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GOLDENROD Revision - 10-21-07 90.
The Germans are coming into the forest. I don't know what is going to become of us.
It doesn't matter. If I had stayed in the ghetto I'd be dead. You saved my life.
No. You have saved mine. He reaches for her but before they can begin to make love again-- THE BLANKET DOOR IS PUSHED ASIDE. Malbin is there
Oh... ..I..... Hello, Lilka.
Hello, Asael.
Yes?
We've caught one.

head_text.subj: A GERMAN SS SCOUT, HANDS TIED BEHIND HIS BACK 137

text: is led into the clearing. He wears the same uniform as those who marched the villagers into the forest for execution.
He's a scout.
They're coming for us. Group members have begun to gather around him. They begin to hurl insults -- schtik drek, paskudnyak -- as the hapl man is pushed to his knees.
We found this in his pouch. He hands Tuvia a sheaf of documents -- including a map. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 91.
Entrance points, wetlands, obstacles. (hands it to Shimon) You read this.
(re: the documents) They've assigned an entire division to surround the forest. A tidal wave is coming.
Don't they have a war to fight?
(still reading) Assault begins in two days. Passover. How fitting. Meanwhile, some of the group have begun TORMENTING the ma
Monster! He kicks him in the head.
Bulvan! Shulman PUNCHES him in the face.
Bitte....Bitte...
(to Asael) Did you reach Viktor?
He's on his way. The tormenting of the poor courier is gaining intensity.
The German lets loose a torrent of pleading.
Ich habe frau und kinder!
He says he has a wife and children. Lazar picks up a stick. The German tries to crawl away; the crowd blocks his escape, pushing him back into the center. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 91A.
So did I!
If you let him go, he will lead them back here. Tuvia looks at Malbin. What to do? (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 92.
Ask if he'll promise not to reveal our location. Shimon translates.
Sie mussen versprechen nicht zu sagan wo wir sind. The man looks up at him, pleadingly.
Nein....Nein...
He'll say anything. He breaks the stick across the man's back.
We want justice...

Justice... Soon it is a chant: "Justice! .Justice!" Tuvia looks at their faces. Only months ago they were decorous, civilize Now they are hungry, almost feral. Murderous. Bella has been silently watching. She steps into the circ looks down at the terrified German man.
My son's name was David. David Kagan. We SEE now that she is holding a sharpened hoe.
He was fifteen. He had blue eyes. She raises it above her head.
He played the piano. She swings with all her might. The others watch with a mi of thrilled horror and perverse delight. A line has been crossed. Riva steps forward, holding a large shovel.
My sister's name was Ellie... As she swings the shovel, the CAMERA begins to back away. Miriam steps forward, carrying a large rock.
My husband was Meyer... The group closes in, obscuring our view of the body. Aron can't take any more. He runs off into the woods. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 A92.
My parents, Sol and Raya. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 92A.
For my daughter, Sonya.
For my mother.
My sister.
My whole family.

Tuvia closes his eyes. He has done nothing to stop it. Asael looks at Malbin and Shimon. They are undone by what they have witnessed. Tuvia walks away. Behind them, the group separates -- staring at the lifele body on the ground. And then they look at each other, the blood lust sated, beginning to reckon with what they have done. What they have become.

head_text.subj: TUVIA STANDS ALONE IN THE FOREST, HIS FACE IN SHADOW

text: He sees Aron, squatting beside a tree, crying silently. Tuvia kneels beside him, cradling him.

Reeboynoy shel oylum... Lord of the Universe. We have done unspeakable things yet still I seek your mercy... He HEARS something. Malbin waits at the edge of the fores His face is drawn and pale from what has just happened. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 93.
Viktor is here.

are waiting in the clearing. Tuvia approaches. He and Zus nod to each other but do not speak. It is excruciating. Tuvia and Viktor walk into the woods. Zus waits with othe BODYGUARDS as Asael joins them. Zus wears a Nazi jacket.
He doesn't look good.
I could say the same about you. Where'd you get the jacket?
Let's just say the former owner no longer had need of it. Zus winks. The other bodyguards stare impassively.
Embrace me. Asael looks confused for a moment, then embraces him.
(WHISPERING)
Hide this. (shoves a revolver into his pocket) Wolnicky stores ammunition for us in his barn. There's no guard. He slaps Asael fondly on the cheek and rejoins his comrad
sit on a downed tree and converse in Russian, with subtit
You found these on the prisoner? Tuvia nods. Viktor studies the scout's documents. Tisking
We can't fight an entire division.
The battle on the Eastern Front has begun. The more troops we engage here, the fewer they have to attack the Motherland. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE GREEN Revision - 10-14-07 93A.
We've done our part for the Motherland. (CONTINUED)
BUFF Revision - 9-2-07 94.
My orders are to take command of all partisan operations. You will bring the rest of your fighters to me.
And the others? Old people, women and children.
In war there are casualties.
And if I refuse?
You are officially a deserter. Do you know the policy on dealing with deserters? Viktor unfolds a paper flyer from his pocket.

...The Germans are offering fifty thousand marks for information leading to your capture. (hands it to him) Not a very flattering likeness. Too Jewish. Viktor rejoins his bodyguards, turns back for a last word
Have your men in my camp by tonight. He walks off. Asael takes the wanted poster from Tuvia.
I wouldn't show this around. There are some who'd turn you in for less.

Down below, Viktor and the Russian partisans have struck their tents and hidden beneath the sheltering trees. Viktor's gaze follows the plane. He gives an order into a field radio. Zus has been listening. (CONTINUED)
SALMON Revision - 8-19-07 95.
You want them to find Tuvia's camp. Viktor just looks at him.
You're deliberately sacrificing them so we can remain safe?
No. So we can keep fighting. Everyone must sacrifice in the struggle.
Those are my brothers.

I am your brother! He is your brother! Comrade Zus. Your Jewish sentimentality is heart-warming, but counter-revolutionary. Zus has secretly known he would hear these words. He grip his rifle but holds his tongue.
Tuvia stares up at it. Have they been spotted? Shimon is sitting nearby with a group of children. He loo pale. His cough is worse. He is very ill.

...but the children of Israel were afraid to leave Egypt. Until Moses said, 'Do not trust in me, trust in God.' He will take care of you' (a wrenching cough) And so tomorrow we celebrate the Passover by sitting around and arguing just as we have done for centuries. Tuvia stares at them, a curious expression on his face. Malbin comes to stand beside him.
(looking at the plane) Did it see us? (CONTINUED)
PINK Revision - 7-18-07 96.
Tomorrow is Passover. Yes?
...How should I know?
Moses. The Exodus. Malbin doesn't get it at first.
--He left before Pharaoh could stop them. Now Malbin understands. He looks at Shimon.
You want to move them all? The old, the sick. They'll never make it. It isn't the first time Tuvia has consigned people to the death, and apparently it won't be the last.
We leave now. Spread the word.
is a blur of activity as everyone mobilizes for evacuatio Sacks and cooking equipment is tied onto impromptu packs. Asael and Malbin coax the older people into motion--
Come, tateh--

But my tools-- The SOUND of approaching aircraft. Tuvia searches the sky Riva pairs each of the elderly with a child. Tamara tucks her newborn under her coat. The SOUND of the approaching aircraft grows LOUDER. Peopl look up, shielding their eyes. Then from out of the sun, two ominous silhouettes:

head_text.subj: THE SCREAMING WHISTLE OF THE FIRST BOMBER 144

text: panics the crowd. (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 97.

Some race into the forest; others are frozen. Tuvia grabs people and bodily drags them to cover. STRAFING 20MM CANNON chew up the ground. Several people are hit before they can reach cover. Lilka herds everyone she can into:
where people crowd in like sardines. Chaya and Riva gathe children around them. They hear the WHISTLE of an incomin shell....BOOM! Dirt from the roof rains down on them.
Dirt and debris everywhere. AN INCENDIARY SHELL HITS high in a tree. Its branches burst into flame. An hysterical woman leaps out of a bunker and is BLOWN AP
Zus listens helplessly to the distant sound of bombs drop on his brothers.
It explodes into a million pieces. Wood shrapnel everywhe Where once was a bunker, now there is only a gaping crate Tuvia races into the maelstrom to help the wounded.
He tries to clear his head but he cannot focus. ALL SOUND FADES AWAY to be replaced by a high-pitched hum.
Falling dirt and debris, tumbling bodies, exploding bunke a surreal effect.
Cowering in safety, Malbin sees Tuvia lying in the open a gathers his courage -- RACING through danger to his side.
Are you alright? Tuvia shakes his head, points to his ears. He cannot hear (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 98.
When Tuvia speaks, his WORDS sound DULL and MUFFLED.
Malbin looks around, panicked. Asael appears out of the smoke, yells at Malbin above the din.

Get them out of the bunkers! Malbin runs off. Asael helps Tuvia to his feet. A nearby explosion SHOWERS THEM with dirt as they CRAWL to safety. The world RAMPS BACK TO NORMAL SPEED at a dizzying rate.
We need to hold them off...until the rest are safe. Tuvia still can't hear. Asael pantomimes firing a rifle.
Tuvia nods, trying to clear the buzzing in his head.
With Levine and Miriam... There. (points out positions) Lazar, Rosa, and Schmuel. There and there. (Tuvia nods) And me. Tuvia shakes his head, no.
Yes. He runs off. Still clearing his head, Tuvia regains his footing -- suddenly realizing the the bombing has stopped GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 98A.

head_text.subj: AT THE ENTRY WAY TO A ZEMYLANKA 151

text: Malbin appears, eyes wild.
Everybody out! Now! But the group's natural reaction is to stay huddled in sa (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 99.
This gets the job done. People begin to crawl out.
YOUNG PEOPLE holding hands with OLD, PARENTS with CHILDRE on their backs. Tuvia urges Lilka and Bella to hurry them into the woods.

take up their assigned positions: Levine mans the heavy machine gun behind a log; Lazar, Miriam and Rosa in the trees. Tuvia anxiously waits for the last of the women and child to disappear into the forest.
Tuvia realizes the bombers have broken off their attack. He knows the ground troops will soon follow. He turns to Asael, grabbing his shoulders.
Don't try to fight... Just slow them down. Then join us. Asael nods. No need for more words. They embrace fiercely Asael pushes Chaya toward Tuvia.
Take her. She resists, clinging to his arm for a moment.
Come. He forces her to join him and catch up to the others.
is eerily quiet as the dust begins to settle. The defende check their weapons with grim efficiency. They are no lon inept innocents; they have become warriors.
Tuvia catches up with the fleeing group and urges them on
We study their faces. Beautiful in their stoic acceptance (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 99A.
SUDDENLY -- A FUSILLADE from the woods. Rosa falls dead. The defenders RETURN FIRE. Levine fires the machine gun; Miriam feeds the belt.

head_text.subj: UP AHEAD WITH THE FLEEING GROUP 157

text: Tuvia hears small arms fire. He knows what it means. BUFF Revision - 9-2-07 100.

The rear guard action can't hold out for very long. Tree by tree, they begin to fall back. Asael fires blindly into the murky shadows. The SOUND of man crying out. Then Levine is hit. Miriam pushes him out of the way and TAKES OVER. She expertly kills several assault troops who appear out of the woods. The rest of the attackers TAKE COVER.
Malbin waits anxiously for Tuvia, clutching a map.
(struggling to control his panic) This swamp here...goes...for miles.
Show me.

Lazar runs from tree to tree, keeping up a steady stream fire. He is surprisingly brave. Until A GRENADE flies out of the woods and lands at his feet, killing him instantly The Assault Troops have begun to outflank them. Asael is suddenly in jeopardy. Sara sees the danger.

Miriam keeps their ATTACKERS pinned down as the two men race for new positions. Then she is hit. She keeps firing anyway, her finger locked on the trigger even as she is dying. More troops begin firing from their flank. Asael has no choice but to break off. They race into the woods.
Tuvia hears the guns go silent. This, too, has meaning.

head_text.subj: A RISE REVEALS THE IMMENSITY OF THE KRASNAYA GORKA SW

text: Malbin stares at what lies ahead.
Oh, my God... (CONTINUED)
TAN Revision - 9-10-07 100A.
Are the others back yet? (Malbin looks stricken; he shakes his head) ..Asael? Malbin shakes his head once more. Asael is not coming bac Chaya begins to weep. Riva comforts her.
We've got to keep going!
The Germans will be here any minute!
(to Tuvia) Do we wait...a while?
We could hide...
I say, fight them here.
Yes. Fight!
That's crazy! Tuvia is in hell. If he waits for Asael, he risks them al being caught. Suddenly it all falls apart. Tuvia sinks to his knees as if his legs can no longer bear his weight.

Tuvia--? Tuvia can't speak. He has no more answers. Nothing to say. He stares at the impenetrable swamp. The end of the line. The sudden vacuum of leadership is felt by them all. They stare at one another, anxious and rudderless.
My father cannot make it.
There are snakes-- Tamara's newborn is crying. She tries to comfort it. An old woman stares at the swamp in terror.
The children...
We'll put them on our shoulders. (CONTINUED)
TAN Revision - 9-10-07 100A1.
Tuvia, what do we do? Oppenheim is petrified. Rona is crying.
And still Tuvia is silent. More arguing. A general MURMUR of dread is rising. Malbin goes to kneel beside Shimon, who is covered in swe undone by the forced march.
What's wrong with him?
(fighting for breath) ...He... ..is... ..tired. Malbin hears something, looks up.
They have been found. Lilka kneels beside Tuvia. (CONTINUED)
TAN Revision - 9-10-07 100B.
She takes his hand silently.
He shakes his head.
You have a weapon? She shows him her revolver. He checks the clip, then look into her eyes.
Use it on yourself before you let them take you. She nods gravely. Suddenly a VOICE interrupts.
Why are we stopping? Everyone turns. It's Asael. Back from the dead. He hands off a wounded comrade to Riva's care.
(WILD-EYED)
They're coming! (to Tuvia) Why aren't we moving? Tuvia looks up at him, lost. Almost helpless.
We must keep going!
In there?
It is impossible! More murmuring. Asael raises his voice.
Nothing is impossible! What we have done is impossible! The murmuring quiets. Asael meets Tuvia's eyes. He is literally willing his old brother to be strong for them, as he has been, time and again.
God will not part these waters. We will do it ourselves.
But how? (CONTINUED)
GOLDENROD Revision - 8-16-07 100B1.
Not by miracles. By our strength. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 100C.
(turning to the man beside him) Take the rope from your pack. (confused; he obeys) Now, you....give me your belt.
We don't have enough rope.
We'll link arms. Make a chain. A human chain.
What are you talking about? Tuvia is deeply moved. His little brother has become a man. Once more, he finds his voice.
Each person takes care of the other. (meeting Asael's eye) .Give him your belt. Asael nods at Tuvia gratefully. The group is hushed, apprehensive. Then:
Removes his belt and offers it to Asael.
And then another. One by one they offer them. There is something quietly heroic in the gesture. Tuvia looks at the group, looks away, fighting back emoti SALMON Revision - 8-18-07 100D-100E.
People link arms and hold on for dear life yet still they flounder. A man goes under, is pulled up. A harrowing undertaking.

head_text.subj: 162AA THE BELTS ARE ROPED ACROSS THE DEEP POOL 162AA

text: People cling to it as they drag themselves, hand over han (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 101.

head_text.subj: 162B SOMEONE CLIMBS OUT TO WALK ALONG THE BANK. 162B

text: No tracks on land. Get back in. It is almost impossible to make any progress. Especially when one is weak and malnourished.

The mud sticks to their clothes, faces. Soon they are indistinguishable from their surroundings. When one person sinks in the muck, it takes three to get him back on his feet. The column slows. Tuvia gestures for them to keep moving. They can't. Literally cannot. He begins to physically push them on. Sometimes harshly. Eventually they are moving again.
Gnarled bare trees shrouded in mist. They trudge forward, their expressions wan and empty. Tuvia find Malbin and pulls him aside.
(WHISPERING)
How much farther? Malbin shrugs his shoulders. Who knows...?

head_text.subj: 163A THE WATER IS ALMOST HEAD HIGH 163A

text: Parents hoist children onto their shoulders, hold weapons overhead as they claw at tall reeds to propel themselves forward, step by tortuous step. SHIMON clings to a tree. His wracking cough is terrifying and he is deathly pale.
Come... Shimon can't catch his breath, he just shakes his head, n He can't go on. Tuvia half-drags, half-carries him onward
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 102.

head_text.subj: A SPIT OF LAND IN THE SWAMP

text: They rest, eat what little food is left. A litter carryin Shimon is deposited on dry ground. He is barely alive.
Is he...? Tuvia shakes his head. It's only a matter of time. The Spotter Plane drones overhead.
Take off your glasses. Reflections. Tuvia moves off to check on the others.
Shimon, listen to me, the physical plane is just an illusion. Only the spiritual plane is real.
(fighting for breath) No. The physical plane is where man acts to redeem himself.
You've redeemed yourself enough, you should shut up now.
Look who's talking about shutting up... I need to tell you something.
(leans closer) What is it?
You shouldn't think so much. The world around you is beautiful.
(stunned; looks around) This world?
Even this one. Tuvia has come to sit beside Lilka. She leans into him.
We're lost.
No. ..No. She puts her arms around him. (CONTINUED)
CHERRY Revision - 9-2-07 102A.
They hold each other and drift off to sleep.
sit around a campfire at the edge of the swamp.
The LIGHTS of their fire can be seen flickering through t reeds as the ragged column MOVES SILENTLY past.
Not a sound. Pass the word. We watch as the ORDER is passed down the line. Parents hold hands over their childrens' mouths. Shimon i carried on an improvised litter made of branches.
Panchenko and a few others are on horseback. Behind them the rest of the Partisans are marching away. Zus and the Jewish fighters are on foot, awaiting orders. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 103.
You will hold this crossroads until the brigade has completed its retreat. Zus looks around at the position.
For how long? Panchenko's orders are never to be questioned.
Until you are ordered to withdraw.
And if we cannot hold the position? Panchenko looks at Gramov, who stands nearby cradling a submachine gun.
Comrade Gramov will enforce discipline, if necessary. Gramov smiles. The implications are clear: nobody retreat
You have served us well, Comrade.

(a wintry smile) I am so honored, Comrade. Panchenko wheels his horse and gallops off. Zus and his men take cover in the woods. In the distance we can HEAR the unmistakable SOUND of approaching armor. Lova kneels beside Zus.
What are we doing here? Zus? Half a mile down the road, A TANK rumbles into view.

Tell me. Who are we doing this for? With a shaking hand, Zus tries to light a Molotov cocktai but his matches are wet. He reaches into his pocket for more. Instead he finds the mezuzah that was once affixed his family's door. As he stares at it, the SOUND of the approaching tank gro louder.
YELLOW Revision - 7-30-07 103A-105.
empties at last into a shallow river. On the opposite ban is dry land, and beyond, the deep forest. And safety. The bedraggled group makes their way across.
(CONTINUED)
GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 106-106A.
Asael pulls people up onto dry ground. They lie there, freezing and exhausted. Some cannot control their shiveri

What's next...Sinai? Tuvia can't help but laugh. Soon they are all laughing. It ripples throughout the group. Joyous. Contagious. An overwhelming feeling of relief. They are safe. Tuvia lies on the ground. All the adrenaline has suddenly left his body. Then Aron appears, tugging at his sleeve. Shimon is asking for him. Tuvia kneels down beside his teacher, whose eyes are clos Malbin is weeping quietly. Who will he argue with?
(a whisper) .Tuvia...
Right here. Shimon is at the end.
...Something...to say...
Shhhh...
...no...please... (finding the strength) I almost lost...my faith....but you...were sent..by God..to save us.
Ridiculous.
I know... ... But just...in case... .I thank....HIM... .and I thank you. He closes his eyes. It's too much for Tuvia. Hard as he tries, he cannot stop the tears from filling his eyes. (CONTINUED)
GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 107.
Trees begin to FALL OVER -- as if pushed by a dinosaur.
emerges onto the banks, less than a quarter-of-mile away.
The menacing gun turning in their direction.

head_text.subj: THE GROUP IS CAUGHT OUT IN THE OPEN. 171

text: THE TANK ROARS FIRE. The first round EXPLODES among them. Several are killed.

Back to the river! He pushes people down. They cling to the banks, cowering. THOSE WITH WEAPONS take cover, using the embankment as if it were the lip of a trench. They RETURN FIRE -- old men, young women, even some child

head_text.subj: A SQUAD OF GERMAN INFANTRY ADVANCES 172

text: behind the tank, using it as protection. Aron kills one. But the Germans are well-trained. They direct a withering fire -- forcing the partisans to keep their heads below the embankment.

It turns its attentions on the riverbank -- its first rou SAILS OVERHEAD, sending up a huge geyser of water. But the next round PLOWS INTO THE EARTH, tearing a huge chunk of earth and killing two of the brigade. TUVIA grabs a satchel and begins filling it with grenades He throws the satchel over Malbin's head, grabs his arm a races, crouching low, beneath the lip of the riverbank. Asael provides covering fire. So do Lilka, Chaya and the women alongside the men.

A stand of trees hides Tuvia from view as he climbs out o the river and heads into the forest. He pulls Malbin down just as A SQUAD OF GERMAN INFANTRY approaches and begins set up a heavy machine gun. (CONTINUED)
GREEN Revision - 8-8-07 107A.

Tuvia POPS UP behind them, spraying them with his submach gun. He then turns the heavy machine gun on the infantry advancing behind the tank -- to devastating effect. But now, the tank turns its attention to Tuvia. Its machi gun begins to chew up the forest, forcing Tuvia to take cover. Without pausing to think, Malbin grabs a grenade from the satchel and races toward the tank. It falls pitifully short, exploding harmlessly as Malbin cut down. DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 108.

head_text.subj: TUVIA IS NOW ISOLATED AND PINNED DOWN 173

text: Bullets tear chunks out of trees as he tries to take cove

head_text.subj: THE TURRET SWIVELS IN HIS DIRECTION

text: It is only a matter of moments before he is dead.

head_text.subj: WHEN SUDDENLY FROM OUT OF THE WOODS

text: Zus and the rest of Jewish fighters emerge, firing on the run. Without regard for his own life, Zus charges. The German infantry is caught in a cross-fire as the Biel brigade climbs out the river, firing wildly. Zus guns down the tank commander manning the machine gun from the open hatch. Jumps onto the tank and DROPS A GREN inside. An EXPLOSION of BLACK SMOKE BILLOWS. Zus stands up amid the billowing smoke. He sees Tuvia who is staring back at him.
Asael is the first to reach Tuvia, who is carrying the Ge assault machine gun.
Only weapons and ammunition! Spread the word. Tuvia hands him the machine gun.
Anything else? Tuvia looks at him. Is he fucking with him? Just a little
Go on. Lilka is carrying a small child.
Lilka, please help. We've got to get the injured into the forest.
What about the dead?

Everybody gather your things! We have to get out of the open! Nearby, Aron removes the machine from the tank and hands to Zus. Bella approaches. Zus embraces her. Tuvia seizes one of the German rifles. He yells to Shulma
Shulman! Weapons only! Tell them. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 108A.
Shulman follows Tuvia's order.
(throwing the weapon) You've been promoted. Congratulations! Tuvia turns, sees Bella with Zus. They see him. Zus hands Bella the machine gun from the tank and approaches.
Where is the rest of your unit?
Good question.
You are going back?
No. They look at each other. So much unsaid. No time to say it.
We've got to build a new camp. Zus nods.
Perhaps you have room for one more? (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE BLUE Revision - 9-17-07 109.
Tuvia reaches out his arms and they embrace fiercely.

They walk in silence. Lilka comes to walk beside him, resting her head on his shoulder as they walk. Tuvia looks up at the shafts of light slanting through th towering trees, as if allowing himself to appreciate its beauty for the first time. Suddenly, he stops, listening, puzzled.
Don't you hear it?
What...?
Nothing. Isn't it beautiful? We HOLD on Tuvia. He has aged ten years in one. (CONTINUED)
PINK Revision - 7-18-07 110.

But for now he allows himself a brief moment of satisfact We might even see the ghost of a smile. But it is short- lived as Asael appears by his side and we see concern onc again clouding his face. Another problem to attend to. And as THE CAMERA BEGINS TO PULL AWAY he is already hurry to catch up with the others. As they all disappear from sight into the sheltering dark of the woods, these words appear on screen: THEY LIVED IN THE FOREST FOR TWO MORE YEARS.

head_text.subj: IN THEIR NEW CAMP THEY BUILT A SCHOOL, A HOSPITAL, A NURS
AND STILL MORE CAME TO FIND THEM.
AT THE TIME OF LIBERATION, TWELVE HUNDRED WALKED OUT OF T

text: Park Avenue. Traffic. More words on screen: ASAEL JOINED THE RUSSIAN ARMY AND DIED SIX MONTHS LATER. ZUS AND TUVIA EMIGRATED TO THE UNITED STATES. In the taxi, THE ELDERLY MAN thrusts his hand through the slot in the Plexiglas window separating him from the driv
Here is money. I can get more. So much more. Take it, please.
No, no... Indeed, when the CABBIE speaks, though the voice is older and somewhat frail, we recognize it as Tuvia's.
What else can I give you, do for you?
Nothing, it isn't necessary. Tears stream down the elderly man's cheeks.
We are alive because of you. (looks at his son) My children. His children. So many. .Thousands. (CONTINUED)
DOUBLE CHERRY Revision - 11-1-07 111.
Behind them, HORNS are HONKING. This is New York City.
Please, the traffic...
Bless you, Tuvia Bielski. May the Lord bless you and keep you all the days of your life.

head_text.subj: THE CAB PULLS AWAY FROM THE CURB INTO THE RAIN -

text: Papa, who was that man? The Elderly Man watches the cab pull away, wiping his eye
That wasn't a man. That was an angel. As the cab pulls away, the CAMERA CRANES UP until it is lost in an anonymous sea of traffic. These words appear o

head_text.subj: TUVIA BIELSKI NEVER SOUGHT RECOGNITION FOR WHAT HE DID.
HE DROVE A CAB IN NEW YORK CITY FOR TWENTY YEARS.
TUVIA AND LILKA REMAINED MARRIED UNTIL HIS DEATH IN 1987.
